State\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e—Josh Herman\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(Photo Credit: iStock / \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.istockphoto.com/portfolio/m_pavlov?mediatype=illustration\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003em_pavlov\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"comment_count\":2,\"issue_slugs\":[\"health\",\"government\",\"elections\",\"federal-agencies\",\"voting-rights\"],\"created_at\":\"2020-05-12T17:46:19.182Z\",\"status\":\"published\",\"snippet\":\"What's the story?\\n\\nThe coronavirus outbreak has disrupted the 2020 election calendar, prompting states to shift their\",\"html_byline\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 5.12.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":2,\"reaction_config_id\":null,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-05-12T17:46:20.036Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"5.12.20\",\"issue_ids\":[\"government\",\"federal-agencies\",\"elections\",\"voting-rights\",\"health\"]},{\"title\":\"Domestic Violence Rises During COVID-19 - Here Are Resources to Get Help\",\"id\":44119,\"slug\":\"44119-domestic-violence-rises-covid-19-resources-get-help\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/44119-domestic-violence-rises-covid-19-resources-get-help\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/44119-domestic-violence-rises-covid-19-resources-get-help/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/44119/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003cp\u003eAccording to UN Secretary-General António Guterres, global COVID-19 lockdowns have led to a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/06/827908402/global-lockdowns-resulting-in-horrifying-surge-in-domestic-violence-u-n-warns\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003esharp increase in domestic violence \u003c/a\u003earound the world.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn an early April news briefing, Guterres\u0026nbsp;said,\u003c/p\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\\\"For many women and girls, the threat looms largest where they should be safest — in their own homes... We know lockdowns and quarantines are essential to suppressing COVID-19, but they can trap women with abusive partners. Over the past weeks, as the economic and social pressures and fear have grown, we have seen a horrifying surge in domestic violence.\\\"\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003ch2\u003eGlobal impact on women's safety\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/un-chief-coronavirus-pressures-leading-global-surge-domestic\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eVoice of America\u003c/a\u003e reports that domestic violence rates have surged in France and South Africa. In South Africa, there were \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/03/27/822363982/south-africa-reports-first-covid-19-deaths-goes-into-3-week-lockdown\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003enearly 90,000\u003c/a\u003e reports of violence against women in the first week of lockdown.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://news.un.org/en/story/2020/04/1061052\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eUN\u003c/a\u003e reports that Lebanon and Malaysia have seen a doubling in calls to domestic violence helplines, compared with April 2019.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://news.un.org/en/story/2020/04/1061052\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eUN\u003c/a\u003e reports that domestic violence calls in China had tripled during that country's lockdown.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIn Australia, Google reported a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/breakfast/reports-75-per-cent-spike-in-searches-for-help-with-domestic/12101690\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e75% spike\u003c/a\u003e in searches for help with domestic violence shortly after the country's lockdown orders took effect.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIn Turkey, the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/un-chief-coronavirus-pressures-leading-global-surge-domestic\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003ekilling of women\u003c/a\u003e rose sharply after a stay at home order's issuance on March 11.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eU.S. women at risk\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eWomen in the U.S., like those around the world, are at increased risk of domestic violence during COVID-10 lockdowns.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn early April, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/police-see-rise-domestic-violence-calls-amid-coronavirus-lockdown-n1176151\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eNBC News\u003c/a\u003e reached out to 22 law enforcement agencies across the country, requesting data on domestic violence calls. 18 of the agencies reported a rise in domestic violence calls in March. Among the numbers reported:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eHouston, Texas, police received 300 more domestic violence calls in March than they had in February (about a 20% increase in call volume).\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eCharlotte-Mecklenburg, North Carolina, police received 517 more domestic violence calls in March 2020 as compared to March 2019—an 18% increase in call volume.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePhoenix, Arizona, police received nearly 200 more domestic violence calls (a 6% increase in call volume).\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCherokee County, South Carolina, sheriff \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/police-see-rise-domestic-violence-calls-amid-coronavirus-lockdown-n1176151\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eSteve Mueller\u003c/a\u003e notes that both women and children are affected by domestic violence:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e“The financial stress [of COVID-19] alone creates a ticking time bomb for some families with a history of domestic violence. Unfortunately many of these domestic violence cases occur in front of children and often the children become victims of abuse and assault, as well.”\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003ch2\u003eDecline in resources for domestic violence\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe rise in domestic violence risk is compounded by shelters' and support organizations' struggles to remain open and solvent during COVID-19.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eMany shelters that occasionally turn to local hotels to house families when they've run out of space are no longer able to do so either due to cost or because hotels are closed.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eFundraisers have been cancelled or postponed due to stay-at-home overs, putting six-figure holes in organizations' annual budgets.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/police-see-rise-domestic-violence-calls-amid-coronavirus-lockdown-n1176151\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eAlejandra Y. Castillo\u003c/a\u003e, CEO of YWCA USA, which operates dozens of shelters for abuse victims nationwide, says:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\\\"We are contending with soaring demand in services but at the same time declining resources and financial support.\\\"\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003ch2\u003eDomestic violence abuse resources\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eIrrespective of the COVID-19 pandemic, there are resources available to help those in dangerous home situations.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.thehotline.org/help/\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eNational Domestic Violence Hotline\u003c/a\u003e (1-800-799-7233) provides help via free, confidential calls in over 200 languages. It also provides help via live chat services on its \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.thehotline.org/help/\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003ewebsite\u003c/a\u003e. Help can also be obtained by texting LOVEIS to 22522.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.nrcdv.org/\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eNational Resource Center on Domestic Violence\u003c/a\u003e hotline (1-800-799-7233) is a resource for domestic violence victims seeking support and local services.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.strongheartshelpline.org/\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eStrongHearts Native Helpline\u003c/a\u003e (1−844-762-848) is dedicated to providing culturally-appropriate support and advocacy for American Indians and Alaska Natives. Its hours are 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. CT.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn addition to these national-level resources, local police departments and community organizations also provide aid for domestic violence victims. In a situation that has escalated to physical violence, calling 911 for emergency services may be the best course of action.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eShare this article and resource list with anyone you know who may be in a dangerous home situation due to COVID-19. If you're able, check in on friends or family whose safety may be at risk in their homes.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e—Lorelei Yang\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(Image Credit: iStockphoto.com / \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/woman-in-fear-of-domestic-abuse-gm180135142-26856931\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003elolostock\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"user_id\":824038,\"cta_prompt\":\"Share these resources to help abuse victims stay safe during the pandemic.\",\"cta_type\":\"share\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/NZaEe7vZ/904f8e/iStock-180135142.jpg\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/NZaEe7vZ/904f8e/iStock-180135142.jpg\",\"small\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/NZaEe7vZ/904f8e/iStock-180135142.jpg\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/NZaEe7vZ/904f8e/iStock-180135142.jpg\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/NZaEe7vZ/904f8e/iStock-180135142.jpg\"},\"profile_id\":1527,\"action_count\":2,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 4.29.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAccording to UN Secretary-General António Guterres, global COVID-19 lockdowns have led to a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/06/827908402/global-lockdowns-resulting-in-horrifying-surge-in-domestic-violence-u-n-warns\\\"\u003esharp increase in domestic violence \u003c/a\u003earound the world.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn an early April news briefing, Guterres said,\u003c/p\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\\\"For many women and girls, the threat looms largest where they should be safest — in their own homes... We know lockdowns and quarantines are essential to suppressing COVID-19, but they can trap women with abusive partners. Over the past weeks, as the economic and social pressures and fear have grown, we have seen a horrifying surge in domestic violence.\\\"\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003ch2\u003eGlobal impact on women's safety\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/un-chief-coronavirus-pressures-leading-global-surge-domestic\\\"\u003eVoice of America\u003c/a\u003e reports that domestic violence rates have surged in France and South Africa. In South Africa, there were \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/03/27/822363982/south-africa-reports-first-covid-19-deaths-goes-into-3-week-lockdown\\\"\u003enearly 90,000\u003c/a\u003e reports of violence against women in the first week of lockdown.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://news.un.org/en/story/2020/04/1061052\\\"\u003eUN\u003c/a\u003e reports that Lebanon and Malaysia have seen a doubling in calls to domestic violence helplines, compared with April 2019.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://news.un.org/en/story/2020/04/1061052\\\"\u003eUN\u003c/a\u003e reports that domestic violence calls in China had tripled during that country's lockdown.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIn Australia, Google reported a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/breakfast/reports-75-per-cent-spike-in-searches-for-help-with-domestic/12101690\\\"\u003e75% spike\u003c/a\u003e in searches for help with domestic violence shortly after the country's lockdown orders took effect.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIn Turkey, the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/un-chief-coronavirus-pressures-leading-global-surge-domestic\\\"\u003ekilling of women\u003c/a\u003e rose sharply after a stay at home order's issuance on March 11.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eU.S. women at risk\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eWomen in the U.S., like those around the world, are at increased risk of domestic violence during COVID-10 lockdowns.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn early April, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/police-see-rise-domestic-violence-calls-amid-coronavirus-lockdown-n1176151\\\"\u003eNBC News\u003c/a\u003e reached out to 22 law enforcement agencies across the country, requesting data on domestic violence calls. 18 of the agencies reported a rise in domestic violence calls in March. Among the numbers reported:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eHouston, Texas, police received 300 more domestic violence calls in March than they had in February (about a 20% increase in call volume).\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eCharlotte-Mecklenburg, North Carolina, police received 517 more domestic violence calls in March 2020 as compared to March 2019—an 18% increase in call volume.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003ePhoenix, Arizona, police received nearly 200 more domestic violence calls (a 6% increase in call volume).\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCherokee County, South Carolina, sheriff \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/police-see-rise-domestic-violence-calls-amid-coronavirus-lockdown-n1176151\\\"\u003eSteve Mueller\u003c/a\u003e notes that both women and children are affected by domestic violence:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e“The financial stress [of COVID-19] alone creates a ticking time bomb for some families with a history of domestic violence. Unfortunately many of these domestic violence cases occur in front of children and often the children become victims of abuse and assault, as well.”\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003ch2\u003eDecline in resources for domestic violence\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe rise in domestic violence risk is compounded by shelters' and support organizations' struggles to remain open and solvent during COVID-19.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eMany shelters that occasionally turn to local hotels to house families when they've run out of space are no longer able to do so either due to cost or because hotels are closed.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eFundraisers have been cancelled or postponed due to stay-at-home overs, putting six-figure holes in organizations' annual budgets.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/police-see-rise-domestic-violence-calls-amid-coronavirus-lockdown-n1176151\\\"\u003eAlejandra Y. Castillo\u003c/a\u003e, CEO of YWCA USA, which operates dozens of shelters for abuse victims nationwide, says:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\\\"We are contending with soaring demand in services but at the same time declining resources and financial support.\\\"\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003ch2\u003eDomestic violence abuse resources\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eIrrespective of the COVID-19 pandemic, there are resources available to help those in dangerous home situations.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.thehotline.org/help/\\\"\u003eNational Domestic Violence Hotline\u003c/a\u003e (1-800-799-7233) provides help via free, confidential calls in over 200 languages. It also provides help via live chat services on its \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.thehotline.org/help/\\\"\u003ewebsite\u003c/a\u003e. Help can also be obtained by texting LOVEIS to 22522.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.nrcdv.org/\\\"\u003eNational Resource Center on Domestic Violence\u003c/a\u003e hotline (1-800-799-7233) is a resource for domestic violence victims seeking support and local services.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.strongheartshelpline.org/\\\"\u003eStrongHearts Native Helpline\u003c/a\u003e (1−844-762-848) is dedicated to providing culturally-appropriate support and advocacy for American Indians and Alaska Natives. Yourself on COVID-19 with These Trusted Scientific Resources\",\"id\":44010,\"slug\":\"44010-educate-covid-19-trusted-scientific-resources\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/44010-educate-covid-19-trusted-scientific-resources\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/44010-educate-covid-19-trusted-scientific-resources/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/44010/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003cp\u003eAs COVID-19 continues to grip the globe, the sheer amount of information — and, more troublingly, misinformation — seems to grow exponentially on a day-by-day basis.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eTo educate yourself, here are a few of the best resources for accessing high-quality, unbiased information:\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eScientific and medical publications and research\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.thelancet.com/coronavirus\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Lancet\u003c/em\u003e’s COVID-19 resource center\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.scientificamerican.com/\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eScientific American\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.nature.com/articles/d41591-020-00006-0\\\" center\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.elsevier.com/connect/coronavirus-information-center\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eElsevier’s Novel Coronavirus class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 4.22.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAs yourself, here are a few of the best resources for accessing high-quality, unbiased information:\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eScientific and medical publications and COVID-19 continues to grip the globe, the sheer amount of information — and, more troublingly, misinformation — seems to grow\",\"html_byline\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 4.22.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":1,\"reaction_config_id\":null,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-04-22T23:02:32.529Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"4.22.20\",\"issue_ids\":[\"business\",\"science-and-technology\",\"public-safety\",\"health\",\"technology\"]},{\"title\":\"How to Wear a Face Mask and Not Fog Glasses\",\"id\":43993,\"slug\":\"43993-wear-face-mask-fog-glasses\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/43993-wear-face-mask-fog-glasses\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/43993-wear-face-mask-fog-glasses/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/43993/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003cp\u003eGlasses wearer can plainly see (or not) that wearing a mask to prevent the spread of COVID-19 causes lens to fog up. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhile taking off your glasses and wiping them down is a simple enough solution in most circumstances, this isn't necessarily the best move if you're outdoors in the middle of a pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSo, what's a bespeckled citizen to do? Luckily, there are a few simple tips to keep glasses from fogging up while wearing a face mask or covering.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eTighten the seal at the top of your mask\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eGlasses fog up while you're wearing a face mask because the mask redirects your breath upwards, rather than forwards, forming droplets on the lenses that condense and fog your lenses up.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eTo prevent this, a tighter seal on the top of the mask can reduce the amount of breath that releases droplets onto your lenses, reducing fogging. \u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eA nose clip, built-in-metal wire on some masks, or a bit of tape adhered to your mask can all be used to tighten your mask's seal.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eAdd tissues to the inside of your mask\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdding folded tissues to the inside top of your face mask or covering can absorb warm droplets from your breath, also reducing fogging. (\u003cstrong\u003eEditor's Note: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is what I do. It works better than I expected.)\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf you go this route, remember to dispose of the tissues after each use.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eUse a commercial anti-fog spray\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eAnti-fog sprays used for swimmers' or divers' goggles can also be used on glasses.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eSome anti-fog sprays can cause irritation, so be sure to research non-irritating sprays before purchase.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf an anti-fog spray causes irritation, discontinue use immediately.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eShare these tips with your glasses-wearing friends to help them stay safe and   clear-sighted during the pandemic. And if you're found an effective way to stop your lenses from fogging while wearing a mask, share your tips in the comments below (or patent it).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e—Lorelei Yang\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(Image Credit: iStockphoto.com / \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/young-men-isolated-himself-wearing-a-face-mask-in-quarantine-gm1217001723-355073017\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efreemixer\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"user_id\":824038,\"cta_prompt\":\"Share these useful tips with glasses-wearers.\",\"cta_type\":\"share\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/NZaEe7vZ/238f06/iStock-1217001723.jpg\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/NZaEe7vZ/238f06/iStock-1217001723.jpg\",\"small\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/NZaEe7vZ/238f06/iStock-1217001723.jpg\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/NZaEe7vZ/238f06/iStock-1217001723.jpg\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/NZaEe7vZ/238f06/iStock-1217001723.jpg\"},\"profile_id\":1527,\"action_count\":3,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 4.22.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eGlasses wearer can plainly see (or not) that wearing a mask to prevent the spread of COVID-19 causes lens to fog up. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhile taking off your glasses and wiping them down is a simple enough solution in most circumstances, this isn't necessarily the best move if you're outdoors in the middle of a pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSo, what's a bespeckled citizen to do? Luckily, there are a few simple tips to keep glasses from fogging up while wearing a face mask or covering.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eTighten the seal at the top of your mask\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eGlasses fog up while you're wearing a face mask because the mask redirects your breath upwards, rather than forwards, forming droplets on the lenses that condense and fog your lenses up.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eTo prevent this, a tighter seal on the top of the mask can reduce the amount of breath that releases droplets onto your lenses, reducing fogging. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eA nose clip, built-in-metal wire on some masks, or a bit of tape adhered to your mask can all be used to tighten your mask's seal.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eAdd tissues to the inside of your mask\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdding folded tissues to the inside top of your face mask or covering can absorb warm droplets from your breath, also reducing fogging. (\u003cstrong\u003eEditor's Note: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is what I do. It works better than I expected.)\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIf you go this route, remember to dispose of the tissues after each use.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eUse a commercial anti-fog spray\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAnti-fog sprays used for swimmers' or divers' goggles can also be used on glasses.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eSome anti-fog sprays can cause irritation, so be sure to research non-irritating sprays before purchase.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIf an anti-fog spray causes irritation, discontinue use immediately.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eShare these tips with your glasses-wearing friends to help them stay safe and   clear-sighted during the pandemic. And if you're found an effective way to stop your lenses from fogging while wearing a mask, share your tips in the comments below (or patent it).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e—Lorelei Yang\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(Image Credit: iStockphoto.com / \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/young-men-isolated-himself-wearing-a-face-mask-in-quarantine-gm1217001723-355073017\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efreemixer\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"comment_count\":0,\"issue_slugs\":[\"health\",\"science-and-technology\",\"public-safety\",\"emergency-management\",\"your-turn\"],\"created_at\":\"2020-04-21T15:27:48.087Z\",\"status\":\"published\",\"snippet\":\"Glasses wearer can plainly see (or not) that wearing a mask to prevent the spread of COVID-19 causes lens to fog up. While\",\"html_byline\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 4.22.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":3,\"reaction_config_id\":null,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-04-22T22:48:53.961Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"4.22.20\",\"issue_ids\":[\"science-and-technology\",\"public-safety\",\"health\",\"emergency-management\",\"your-turn\"]},{\"title\":\"How to Apply for 'Paycheck Protection Program' Loans If You're Self-Employed, an Independent Contractor, or a Gig Economy Worker\",\"id\":43848,\"slug\":\"43848-apply-paycheck-protection-program-loans-re-self-employed-independent-contractor-gig-economy-worker\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/43848-apply-paycheck-protection-program-loans-re-self-employed-independent-contractor-gig-economy-worker\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/43848-apply-paycheck-protection-program-loans-re-self-employed-independent-contractor-gig-economy-worker/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/43848/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003cp\u003eThe Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act was signed into law by President Donald Trump on March 27, 2020, and one of its key provisions was the creation of forgivable loans for small businesses through the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP). Administered by the Small Business Administration (SBA), the Treasury Dept., and participating financial institutions, the program is also open to self-employed individuals, independent contractors, and people in the “gig economy.” Such workers are eligible to apply for PPP loans as of April 10, 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHow to Apply\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe first step in the process is filing a PPP application with a participating lender.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe SBA created a\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sba.gov/paycheckprotection/find\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003esearch tool\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;that allows you to enter your zip code and find a list of banks, credit unions, and other financial institutions that are eligible to participate in the PPP.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eOnce you have a list of lenders, you’ll want to reach out to your preferred lender.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eSome lenders are only making PPP loans to borrowers they have an existing or previous banking relationship with, so you may want to begin your search with a lender that falls into that category.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eHowever, an existing banking relationship isn’t required for a PPP loan to be approved, so you can contact other eligible lenders as needed until you find one accepting applications.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eApplications are made directly with the lender, and forms may vary, but the SBA has made a\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sba.gov/document/sba-form--paycheck-protection-program-ppp-sample-application-form\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003esample form\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;available that can give you a sense of information you’ll want to have ready.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePPP loans have a 100% federal guarantee, so there is no requirement for a borrower to personally guarantee the loan or to put up collateral.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHow the Loan Forgiveness Works\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eAmounts spent on payroll in the 8 weeks following the loan’s origination date can be forgiven. Eligible expenses include salary, wages, cash tips, insurance premiums, retirement contributions, and covered family \u0026amp; medical leave.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, the Treasury Dept. has advised that up to 25% of the forgiveness amount can cover business-related overhead expenses that were in effect prior to February 15, 2020.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePPP loan amounts that aren’t forgiven after one year are carried forward as a loan with a maturity of 2 years and an interest rate of 1%. PPP loan payments can be completely deferred for at least 6 months, but no later than 1 year.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch3\u003eRESOURCES\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sba.gov/paycheckprotection/find\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eSmall Business Administration - Eligible Lender Search Tool\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sba.gov/funding-programs/loans/paycheck-protection-program-ppp\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eSmall Business Administration - Paycheck Protection Program\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sba.gov/document/sba-form--paycheck-protection-program-ppp-sample-application-form\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eSmall Business Administration - Sample Application Form\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://home.treasury.gov/system/files/136/PPP%20Borrower%20Information%20Fact%20Sheet.pdf\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eTreasury Dept. - Borrower Information Sheet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.uschamber.com/sites/default/files/023595_comm_corona_virus_smallbiz_loan_final.pdf\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eU.S. Chamber of Commerce - Coronavirus Emergency Loan Guide \u0026amp; Checklist\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.uschamber.com/co/start/strategy/cares-act-small-business-guide\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eU.S. Chamber of Commerce - Small Business Guide to the CARES Act\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eLearn more about the small business side of the SBA’s Paycheck Protection Program\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/43575-how-to-apply-small-business-paycheck-protection-program-loans\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ehere\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e— Eric Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(Photo Credit: iStock.com /\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/coronavirus-paycheck-protection-program-sba-7a-loan-gm1217440704-355381721\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003emphillips007\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"user_id\":824038,\"cta_prompt\":\"\",\"cta_type\":\"share\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/gZAMg8wZ/164236/PPA1.jpg\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/gZAMg8wZ/164236/PPA1.jpg\",\"small\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/gZAMg8wZ/164236/PPA1.jpg\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/gZAMg8wZ/164236/PPA1.jpg\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/gZAMg8wZ/164236/PPA1.jpg\"},\"profile_id\":1527,\"action_count\":0,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 4.15.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act was signed into law by President Donald Trump on March 27, 2020, and one of its key provisions was the creation of forgivable loans for small businesses through the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP). Administered by the Small Business Administration (SBA), the Treasury Dept., and participating financial institutions, the program is also open to self-employed individuals, independent contractors, and people in the “gig economy.” Such workers are eligible to apply for PPP loans as of April 10, 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHow to Apply\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe first step in the process is filing a PPP application with a participating lender.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe SBA created a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sba.gov/paycheckprotection/find\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003esearch tool\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e that allows you to enter your zip code and find a list of banks, credit unions, and other financial institutions that are eligible to participate in the PPP.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eOnce you have a list of lenders, you’ll want to reach out to your preferred lender. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eSome lenders are only making PPP loans to borrowers they have an existing or previous banking relationship with, so you may want to begin your search with a lender that falls into that category.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eHowever, an existing banking relationship isn’t required for a PPP loan to be approved, so you can contact other eligible lenders as needed until you find one accepting applications.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eApplications are made directly with the lender, and forms may vary, but the SBA has made a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sba.gov/document/sba-form--paycheck-protection-program-ppp-sample-application-form\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003esample form\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e available that can give you a sense of information you’ll want to have ready.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003ePPP loans have a 100% federal guarantee, so there is no requirement for a borrower to personally guarantee the loan or to put up collateral.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHow the Loan Forgiveness Works\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAmounts spent on payroll in the 8 weeks following the loan’s origination date can be forgiven. Eligible expenses include salary, wages, cash tips, insurance premiums, retirement contributions, and covered family \u0026amp; medical leave.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, the Treasury Dept. has advised that up to 25% of the forgiveness amount can cover business-related overhead expenses that were in effect prior to February 15, 2020.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003ePPP loan amounts that aren’t forgiven after one year are carried forward as a loan with a maturity of 2 years and an interest rate of 1%. PPP loan payments can be completely deferred for at least 6 months, but no later than 1 year.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch3\u003eRESOURCES\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sba.gov/paycheckprotection/find\\\"\u003eSmall Business Administration - Eligible Lender Search Tool\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sba.gov/funding-programs/loans/paycheck-protection-program-ppp\\\"\u003eSmall Business Administration - Paycheck Protection Program\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sba.gov/document/sba-form--paycheck-protection-program-ppp-sample-application-form\\\"\u003eSmall Business Administration - Sample Application Form\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://home.treasury.gov/system/files/136/PPP%20Borrower%20Information%20Fact%20Sheet.pdf\\\"\u003eTreasury Dept. - Borrower Information Sheet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.uschamber.com/sites/default/files/023595_comm_corona_virus_smallbiz_loan_final.pdf\\\"\u003eU.S. Chamber of Commerce - Coronavirus Emergency Loan Guide \u0026amp; Checklist\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.uschamber.com/co/start/strategy/cares-act-small-business-guide\\\"\u003eU.S. Chamber of Commerce - Small Business Guide to the CARES Act\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eLearn more about the small business side of the SBA’s Paycheck Protection Program \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/43575-how-to-apply-small-business-paycheck-protection-program-loans\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ehere\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e— Eric Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(Photo Credit: iStock.com / \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/coronavirus-paycheck-protection-program-sba-7a-loan-gm1217440704-355381721\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003emphillips007\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"comment_count\":0,\"issue_slugs\":[\"small-business\",\"loans\",\"health\",\"emergency-management\",\"economy\"],\"created_at\":\"2020-04-15T18:42:39.173Z\",\"status\":\"published\",\"snippet\":\"The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act was signed into law by President Donald Trump on March 27, 2020,\",\"html_byline\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 4.15.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":0,\"reaction_config_id\":null,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-04-15T18:42:40.034Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"4.15.20\",\"issue_ids\":[\"economy\",\"health\",\"small-business\",\"emergency-management\",\"loans\"]},{\"title\":\"Tips for Staying Safe at the Grocery Store\",\"id\":43847,\"slug\":\"43847-tips-staying-safe-grocery-store\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/43847-tips-staying-safe-grocery-store\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/43847-tips-staying-safe-grocery-store/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/43847/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003cp\u003eAt this point in the COVID-19 pandemic, experts agree that it's safer to have groceries delivered via no-contact delivery if possible. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eHowever, there may be a variety of reasons that compel you to continue shopping for groceries in person. If you must shop in-store, here are some tips to stay safe while pushing your cart through the aisles:\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eMaintain social distancing\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eMaintain social distancing at all times. That means at least six feet of space between you and others.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eDon't crowd against others in aisles and in the check-out line.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eCover your face\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe CDC now recommends that all Americans wear cloth face masks when out in public, including at the grocery store.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eNo face mask? No problem. \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/43651-make-face-mask\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eWe'll teach you how to fashion a DIY mask here\u003c/a\u003e, using a variety of materials. \u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eLeave N95 respirator masks or surgical masks to healthcare workers, who are still facing a shortage of protective personal equipment (PPE).\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eAvoid touching your face\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eTry to avoid touching your face—your eyes, nose, and mouth can be points of entry for the novel coronavirus.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eWash your hands\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/42645-wash-hands-right-way-5-properly-wash-hands\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eWash your hands with soap and water\u003c/a\u003e before and after going out.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eUse hand sanitizer when out.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf you use gloves, use disposable ones and throw them out before getting in your car or as soon as you get home.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eUse wipes\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eWipe your grocery cart or basket down with sanitizing wipes.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eUse wipes that are on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.epa.gov/pesticide-registration/list-n-disinfectants-use-against-sars-cov-2?mod=article_inline\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eEPA's list of disinfectants\u003c/a\u003e for use against SARS-CoV-2.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eMinimize contact with the cashier\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf possible, try to avoid exchanging money or credit cards with the cashier.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eUse contactless payment or a credit card reader when possible.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eDispose of or clean bags and surfaces\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf you use paper or plastic bags that were handled by another person (e.g., a bagger at the store), discard those bags upon returning home and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/42645-wash-hands-right-way-5-properly-wash-hands\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003ewash your hands.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf you're using reusable cloth bags, wash them upon returning home.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eWipe countertops down after putting groceries away.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eAvoid going to the grocery store if you're a member of a vulnerable population\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/43394-americans-elevated-risk-coronavirus\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eCertain vulnerable populations\u003c/a\u003e - people over 65 and those with certain medical conditions - are at greater risk of serious complications from COVID-19.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf you're a member of a vulnerable population, you should avoid going to the grocery store if possible.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eShare these tips to help others stay safe while going to the grocery store.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e—Lorelei Yang\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(Photo Credit: iStockphoto.com / \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca this point in the COVID-19 pandemic, experts agree that it's safer to have groceries delivered via no-contact delivery if possible. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eHowever, there may be a variety of reasons that compel you to continue shopping for groceries in person. If you must shop in-store, here are some tips to stay safe while pushing your cart through the aisles:\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eMaintain social distancing\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eMaintain social distancing at all times. That means at least six feet of space between you and others.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eDon't crowd against others in aisles and in the check-out line.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eCover your face\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe CDC now recommends that all Americans wear cloth face masks when out in public, including at the grocery store.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eNo face mask? No problem. \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/43651-make-face-mask\\\"\u003eWe'll teach you how to fashion a DIY mask here\u003c/a\u003e, using a variety of materials. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eLeave N95 respirator masks or surgical masks to healthcare workers, who are still facing a shortage of protective personal equipment (PPE).\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eAvoid touching your face\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eTry to avoid touching your face—your eyes, nose, and mouth can be points of entry for the novel coronavirus.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eWash your hands\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca out.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eUse hand sanitizer when out.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIf you use gloves, use disposable ones and throw them out before getting in your car or as soon as you get home.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eUse wipes\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eWipe your grocery cart or basket down with sanitizing wipes.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eUse wipes that are on the \u003ca SARS-CoV-2.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eMinimize contact with the cashier\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIf possible, try to avoid exchanging money or credit cards with the cashier.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eUse contactless payment or a credit card reader when possible.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eDispose of or clean bags and surfaces\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIf you use paper or plastic bags that were handled by another person (e.g., a bagger at the store), discard those bags upon returning home and cloth bags, wash them upon returning home.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eWipe countertops down after putting groceries away.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eAvoid going to the grocery 4.15.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":1,\"reaction_config_id\":null,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-04-15T18:30:47.224Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"4.15.20\",\"issue_ids\":[\"science-and-technology\",\"public-safety\",\"health\",\"aging\",\"food-and-agriculture\"]},{\"title\":\"How to Create Your Own COVID-19 Resource Hub\",\"id\":43699,\"slug\":\"43699-create-covid-19-resource-hub\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/43699-create-covid-19-resource-hub\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/43699-create-covid-19-resource-hub/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/43699/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003cp\u003eThere is no questioning the seriousness of the COVID-19 pandemic. While we can't provide a vaccine for the illness, we can help offer a cure for the intense confusion and misinformation surrounding the outbreak.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCountable’s Action Center platform lets you build your own COVID-19 Resource Hub to share your thoughts and inform your community. It's your own personal portal for curating, creating, and delivering content to your community—in a way that facilitates easy, meaningful civic action.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eBelow, you’ll find a simple, step-by-step guide for putting together your Resource Hub.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePrefer a walk-through? Countable CEO Bart Myers has you covered:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"countable-video embed-responsive embed-responsive-4by3\\\"\u003e\u003ciframe class=\\\"embed-responsive-item\\\" src=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/hejqA-bCdYY?showinfo=0\\\" frameborder=\\\"0\\\" allowfullscreen=\\\"true\\\" controls=\\\"true\\\"\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(TIP: Want an idea of what these hubs look like? Click through examples from\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/profiles/usafacts\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e USAFacts\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e,\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/profiles/chelsea-handler\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e Chelsea Handler\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e, and\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/profiles/glaad\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e GLAAD\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eCREATION:\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e1) To create your own Resource Hub, navigate to the button above and\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/action-centers/new\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e click \u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/action-centers/new\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003eCREATE YOUR RESOURCE HUB\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e2) Choose a name for your Action Center and customize your URL. You’ll be redirected to your new Action Center as soon as you’ve completed the process.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/h77r-awWCQkCL7BYv4Mp9gsFXC1-qxl-drTIdBWFQhTm7fV2kZWGO-guuOW9lzpnTpM0YF7So_WiGB3M2EN0eY6n6-OoWxYTg_DtHBbDLO4IYN-3TGaEFnuO8kKaaI83leGrqgvJ\\\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eCUSTOMIZATION:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e3) Select the “Manage” button.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/ppMngG9O8AlU5QaIvC6-EL1FHZM8Rf8LsAUEmrvHrf1z5M9oTKh1kZQvdEBTiqvwFxfmWTcKXK3oa24pw5jZeHKhG1VFN0pVn5DhKuSNC5FQGGMkO1F2uYFCVgrQGkWz-6HMKaPD\\\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e4) You’ll be taken to the Settings Page of your Action Center. Here, you’ll be able to customize - and personalize - your Resource Hub.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eInclude your own branding elements. Add contextual copy. Let your community know what information they can find on your Resource Hub.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eHit “Save” and you’re ready to start populating your hub with material.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/NwqS01wM8_T8JcXSuyJT2iNUl0jdZcT0dWFnErSjq02FlvwY16EGA4b6Bx0tpg6Dv2Myeuh5m7ULXXFrZgUyyF2oUxjc59RT0jCioHe5tphSTKPzycsC9gCS9kSlL6_4NUaBK5UM\\\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/XYiyBatitdpwvuvVSKp0XuvJ-Wqbj_FoPCkBWZvoYkdBVaDft3azquHb5AdcAEce0zO0E8ktM_ea3FJHG_soaHJYEAQLstzA3sngGz4C2pejza6tCRuL-3KoJIYaswyUA1DBdrAE\\\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eCONTENT POPULATION:\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e5) Ready to create your first post in our easy-to-use editor? Just click “CREATE POST”.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eGive it a \u003cstrong\u003eTitle \u003c/strong\u003eand, if you’d like, a \u003cstrong\u003eCall To Action\u003c/strong\u003e (CTA). Use the CTA to ask a question (“Are you making your own mask?”), urge readers to share your content, contact their reps, or sign a petition.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eNext, you’ll choose a CTA button:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/W56w78YE/20390a/CTA%20Dropdown.png\\\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/W56w78YE/5d9936/Emotions.png\\\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e6) Now it’s time to Write Your Story. And you can write it any way you like: include images, videos, bullet-points, embeddable content.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eNot sure what to write? Don’t worry, we’ve got you covered...\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/0P_ZzE2GAH2AqZBpQCpARkiOxBwdnApYGYhX80LG93poJMh3vPLJnZDAMLBpvD3xrSJKRBhEIjt9kf_F83fJv0knU25f77Jgb8eaB0_-8ncwRUyvkOJCMZH2okaF8hiju34RxtrJ\\\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e7) Curate your newsfeed by reposting content from across the Countable site. We can’t wait to see it.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e-The Countable Team\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"comment_count\":0,\"issue_slugs\":[],\"created_at\":\"2020-04-08T04:15:06.833Z\",\"status\":\"published\",\"snippet\":\"There is no questioning the seriousness of the COVID-19 pandemic. While we can't provide a vaccine for the illness, we can help\",\"html_byline\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 4.16.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":0,\"reaction_config_id\":null,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-04-17T00:43:25.921Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":false,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"4.16.20\",\"issue_ids\":[]},{\"title\":\"When Do Coronavirus Relief Payments Go Out? Are You Eligible?\",\"id\":43656,\"slug\":\"43656-do-coronavirus-relief-payments-go-eligible\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/43656-do-coronavirus-relief-payments-go-eligible\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/43656-do-coronavirus-relief-payments-go-eligible/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/43656/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003cp\u003eThe\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/bills/hr748-116\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCoronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;that President Donald Trump signed into law on March 27, 2020, includes direct cash payments to help Americans dealing with the economic impact of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Here’s what you need to know about payment amounts, eligibility, and what (if anything) you need to do receive the payment.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHow much are the payments? Who is eligible?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eIndividuals can receive a direct cash payment (known as a “recovery rebate check”) of up to $1,200 while married couples can receive up to $2,400. Each child adds $500 to a household’s check.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePayments start to phase-out for individual taxpayers with an adjusted gross income (AGI) of more than $75,000 and for married filers over $150,000. It decreases by $5 for each $100 earned over that threshold, and phases out entirely for individuals who earned over $99,000 and married filers over $198,000.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe AGI is based on a person or household’s most recent tax return ― either the 2019 return if it’s been filed or the 2018 return. You can find your AGI in Box 8b of the 2019 federal 1040 tax return form, or Box 7 of the 2018 return.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAll adults with a Social Security number will be eligible. Dependents, estates \u0026amp; trusts, and unauthorized immigrants are ineligible.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdults who typically aren’t required to file a tax return, such as certain senior citizens, veterans, and individuals with disabilities will need to file a simple tax return to receive the payment even though they won’t owe tax.\u0026nbsp;\u003cem\u003e(UPDATE: The Treasury Dept. has reversed its decision and won't require Social Security beneficiaries to file a simple tax return to receive the payment, instead relying on their information from the SSA.)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eBased on the criteria in the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/bills/hr748-116\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCARES Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the Congressional Research Service\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\\\"https://crsreports.congress.gov/product/pdf/IN/IN11270\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eestimates that 82% of American families will get the full amount\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and only 8% of families (primarily in higher-income brackets) will receive nothing.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://usafacts.org/articles/who-will-get-1200-coronavirus-relief-checks/\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eUSAFacts compiled this table\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;that uses Census Bureau \u0026amp; Internal Revenue Service (IRS) data to show how much different family types at various income levels can expect to receive on average:\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/zGRvmLXnHVhv_BxXab9jMIuHgHaeCZSlwBvvkQ7EXD_EVbdjBEpQvuyjFcAyItYfQpO3GaZFCld-OxmWGD19PJERun32QInRcnkzkV0I-QKfnPAmCWUzCd3uLx-FEE45S9ysenPT\\\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhen do the payments go out? Are they taxable?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eTaxpayers who have set up Direct Deposit with the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) will likely receive cash payments on or around April 17, 2020, which is three weeks after the enactment of the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/bills/hr748-116\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCARES Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003cem\u003e(UPDATE: The Treasury now expects Direct Deposit payments to begin reaching bank accounts on April 13, 2020.)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePeople who don’t have Direct Deposit set up with the IRS will likely receive paper checks in the mail at the address it has on file several weeks later, likely in early May.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf you don’t have a Direct Deposit set up but want to, in the next few weeks the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.irs.gov/newsroom/economic-impact-payments-what-you-need-to-know\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIRS is planning to develop a web-based portal for individuals to provide their banking information to the agency online\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;so you can receive your payment immediately once it’s available.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe “recovery rebates” won’t be treated as taxable income on your 2020 tax return.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHow do I file the tax return needed to receive the payment?\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf you haven’t filed either your 2018 or 2019 tax return with the IRS, you’re encouraged to do so as soon as possible to avoid a delay in receiving your payment.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThese payments will be available throughout the rest of 2020 if you need to visit a tax professional or community organization for help with your tax return.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf you aren’t ordinarily required to file a tax return but are in a group that the IRS is encouraging to file a simple tax return so they can receive a payment, you will soon find the necessary information to do so on\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.irs.gov/coronavirus\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIRS.gov/coronavirus\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. The information you’ll need to provide includes filing status, number of dependents, and Direct Deposit bank account information.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e— Eric Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(Photo Credit: iStock.com /\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/dollar-paper-currency-about-corona-virus-gm1208881079-349604176\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eizzetugutmen\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"user_id\":824038,\"cta_prompt\":\"\",\"cta_type\":\"share\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/gZAMg8wZ/c0354d/Loans.jpg\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/gZAMg8wZ/c0354d/Loans.jpg\",\"small\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/gZAMg8wZ/c0354d/Loans.jpg\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/gZAMg8wZ/c0354d/Loans.jpg\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.countable.us/ul/q_auto/uploads/gZAMg8wZ/c0354d/Loans.jpg\"},\"profile_id\":1527,\"action_count\":0,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 4.6.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/bills/hr748-116\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCoronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e that President Donald Trump signed into law on March 27, 2020, includes direct cash payments to help Americans dealing with the economic impact of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Here’s what you need to know about payment amounts, eligibility, and what (if anything) you need to do receive the payment.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHow much are the payments? Who is eligible?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIndividuals can receive a direct cash payment (known as a “recovery rebate check”) of up to $1,200 while married couples can receive up to $2,400. Each child adds $500 to a household’s check.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003ePayments start to phase-out for individual taxpayers with an adjusted gross income (AGI) of more than $75,000 and for married filers over $150,000. It decreases by $5 for each $100 earned over that threshold, and phases out entirely for individuals who earned over $99,000 and married filers over $198,000.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe AGI is based on a person or household’s most recent tax return ― either the 2019 return if it’s been filed or the 2018 return. You can find your AGI in Box 8b of the 2019 federal 1040 tax return form, or Box 7 of the 2018 return.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAll adults with a Social Security number will be eligible. Dependents, estates \u0026amp; trusts, and unauthorized immigrants are ineligible.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdults who typically aren’t required to file a tax return, such as certain senior citizens, veterans, and individuals with disabilities will need to file a simple tax return to receive the payment even though they won’t owe tax. \u003cem\u003e(UPDATE: The Treasury Dept. has reversed its decision and won't require Social Security beneficiaries to file a simple tax return to receive the payment, instead relying on their information from the SSA.)\u003c/em\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eBased on the criteria in the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/bills/hr748-116\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCARES Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the Congressional Research Service \u003ca href=\\\"https://crsreports.congress.gov/product/pdf/IN/IN11270\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eestimates that 82% of American families will get the full amount\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and only 8% of families (primarily in higher-income brackets) will receive nothing.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://usafacts.org/articles/who-will-get-1200-coronavirus-relief-checks/\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eUSAFacts compiled this table\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e that uses Census Bureau \u0026amp; Internal Revenue Service (IRS) data to show how much different family types at various income levels can expect to receive on average:\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/zGRvmLXnHVhv_BxXab9jMIuHgHaeCZSlwBvvkQ7EXD_EVbdjBEpQvuyjFcAyItYfQpO3GaZFCld-OxmWGD19PJERun32QInRcnkzkV0I-QKfnPAmCWUzCd3uLx-FEE45S9ysenPT\\\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhen do the payments go out? Are they taxable?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eTaxpayers who have set up Direct Deposit with the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) will likely receive cash payments on or around April 17, 2020, which is three weeks after the enactment of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/bills/hr748-116\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCARES Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. \u003cem\u003e(UPDATE: The Treasury now expects Direct Deposit payments to begin reaching bank accounts on April 13, 2020.)\u003c/em\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003ePeople who don’t have Direct Deposit set up with the IRS will likely receive paper checks in the mail at the address it has on file several weeks later, likely in early May.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIf you don’t have a Direct Deposit set up but want to, in the next few weeks the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.irs.gov/newsroom/economic-impact-payments-what-you-need-to-know\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIRS is planning to develop a web-based portal for individuals to provide their banking information to the agency online\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e so you can receive your payment immediately once it’s available.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe “recovery rebates” won’t be treated as taxable income on your 2020 tax return.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHow do I file the tax return needed to receive the payment? \u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIf you haven’t filed either your 2018 or 2019 tax return with the IRS, you’re encouraged to do so as soon as possible to avoid a delay in receiving your payment. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThese payments will be available throughout the rest of 2020 if you need to visit a tax professional or community organization for help with your tax return.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIf you aren’t ordinarily required to file a tax return but are in a group that the IRS is encouraging to file a simple tax return so they can receive a payment, you will soon find the necessary information to do so on \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.irs.gov/coronavirus\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIRS.gov/coronavirus\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. The information you’ll need to provide includes filing status, number of dependents, and Direct Deposit bank account information.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e— Eric Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e(Photo Credit: iStock.com / \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/dollar-paper-currency-about-corona-virus-gm1208881079-349604176\\\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eizzetugutmen\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"comment_count\":0,\"issue_slugs\":[\"health\",\"jobs\",\"taxes\",\"government\",\"entitlement-reform\"],\"created_at\":\"2020-04-06T21:24:47.124Z\",\"status\":\"published\",\"snippet\":\"The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act that President Donald Trump signed into law on March 27, 2020,\",\"html_byline\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/public-health-resource-center\\\"\u003eCovid-19 Health Resource Center\u003c/a\u003e | 4.6.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":0,\"reaction_config_id\":null,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-04-06T21:24:47.969Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"4.6.20\",\"issue_ids\":[\"government\",\"health\",\"taxes\",\"jobs\",\"entitlement-reform\"]}],\"meta\":{\"pagination\":{\"current_page\":1,\"total_pages\":3,\"total_count\":46}}}","GET::https://www.causes.com/api/v2/articles::profile_id=this-week-in-congress--status=published":"{\"issues\":[{\"id\":\"congress-shenanigans\",\"name\":\"Congress Shenanigans\",\"slug\":\"congress-shenanigans\",\"description\":\"Vote on the latest federal legislation regarding Congress Shenanigans. Democrats to Take Up Immigration Bills \u0026 ERA Ratification Extension While Senate Considers Cabinet Nominees\",\"id\":47074,\"slug\":\"47074-house-democrats-take-immigration-bills-era-ratification-extension-senate-considers-cabinet-nominees\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/47074-house-democrats-take-immigration-bills-era-ratification-extension-senate-considers-cabinet-nominees\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/47074-house-democrats-take-immigration-bills-era-ratification-extension-senate-considers-cabinet-nominees/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/47074/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eCongress returns this week with the House set to consider a pair of immigration bills, legislation to protect women from domestic violence, extend the ratification deadline for the Equal Rights Amendment, and prevent automatic budget cuts triggered by Democrats’ recently enacted spending package. Meanwhile, the Senate will continue to fill Cabinet vacancies.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAfter this work week, the House is expected to go on recess from floor for work for three weeks, while the Senate will be in session for another week prior to a two week recess.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week Monday with a confirmation vote on the nomination of Rep. Deb Haaland (D-NM) to serve as Secretary of the Interior.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe rest of its week is expected to be focused on nominations, with possible votes on the nominations of Isabel Guzman to be Administrator of the Small Business Administration, Katherine Tai to be U.S. Trade Representative, and Xavier Becerra to be Secretary of Health and Human Services.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the impact of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.finance.senate.gov/hearings/a-national-tragedy-covid-19-in-the-nations-nursing-homes\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCOVID-19 in nursing homes\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.foreign.senate.gov/hearings/advancing-effective-us-policy-for-strategic-competition-with-china-in-the-twenty-first-century-031721\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003estrategic competition with China\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.finance.senate.gov/hearings/fighting-forced-labor-closing-loopholes-and-improving-customs-enforcement-to-mandate-clean-supply-chains-and-protect-worker\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003epreventing forced labor in supply chains\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House will start its week on Tuesday, and as of Sunday hasn’t broken down the day-by-day schedule. Over the course of the week, lawmakers are expected to consider 28 relatively bipartisan bills under the fast-track “suspension of the rules” process which requires a supermajority for passage.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is expected to consider legislation to provide a pathway to citizenship “Dreamers” and other groups along with a bill to establish work visas for non-citizen farm workers.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIt will also take up legislation to eliminate the deadline for the ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment, reauthorize programs to prevent violence against women, and prevent automatic spending cuts triggered by the enactment of Democrats’ $1.9 trillion spending bill.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://homeland.house.gov/activities/hearings/the-way-forward-on-homeland-security\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003efuture of homeland security policy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://financialservices.house.gov/calendar/EventSingle.aspx?EventID=406268\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eshort-selling and retail investors\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and an \u003ca href=\\\"https://coronavirus.house.gov/subcommittee-activity/hearings/remote-hearing-rescue-recovery-building-thriving-and-inclusive-post\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003einclusive post-pandemic economy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 5:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eConfirmation of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/47059-know-nominee-deb-haaland-secretary-interior\\\" 6:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr485-117\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.R.
