schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/2da56f/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/2da56f/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/2da56f/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/2da56f/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/2da56f/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":518,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 3.18.21\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eCongress returns this week with the House set to consider a pair of immigration bills, legislation to protect women from domestic violence, extend the ratification deadline for the Equal Rights Amendment, and prevent automatic budget cuts triggered by Democrats’ recently enacted spending package. Meanwhile, the Senate will continue to fill Cabinet vacancies.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAfter this work week, the House is expected to go on recess from floor for work for three weeks, while the Senate will be in session for another week prior to a two week recess.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week Monday with a confirmation vote on the nomination of Rep. Deb Haaland (D-NM) to serve as Secretary of the Interior.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe rest of its week is expected to be focused on nominations, with possible votes on the nominations of Isabel Guzman to be Administrator of the Small Business Administration, Katherine Tai to be U.S. Trade Representative, and Xavier Becerra to be Secretary of Health and Human Services.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the impact of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.finance.senate.gov/hearings/a-national-tragedy-covid-19-in-the-nations-nursing-homes\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCOVID-19 in nursing homes\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.foreign.senate.gov/hearings/advancing-effective-us-policy-for-strategic-competition-with-china-in-the-twenty-first-century-031721\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003estrategic competition with China\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.finance.senate.gov/hearings/fighting-forced-labor-closing-loopholes-and-improving-customs-enforcement-to-mandate-clean-supply-chains-and-protect-worker\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003epreventing forced labor in supply chains\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.  \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House will start its week on Tuesday, and as of Sunday hasn’t broken down the day-by-day schedule. Over the course of the week, lawmakers are expected to consider 28 relatively bipartisan bills under the fast-track “suspension of the rules” process which requires a supermajority for passage.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House is expected to consider legislation to provide a pathway to citizenship “Dreamers” and other groups along with a bill to establish work visas for non-citizen farm workers.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIt will also take up legislation to eliminate the deadline for the ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment, reauthorize programs to prevent violence against women, and prevent automatic spending cuts triggered by the enactment of Democrats’ $1.9 trillion spending bill.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://homeland.house.gov/activities/hearings/the-way-forward-on-homeland-security\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003efuture of homeland security policy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://financialservices.house.gov/calendar/EventSingle.aspx?EventID=406268\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eshort-selling and retail investors\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and an \u003ca href=\\\"https://coronavirus.house.gov/subcommittee-activity/hearings/remote-hearing-rescue-recovery-building-thriving-and-inclusive-post\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003einclusive post-pandemic economy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 5:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eConfirmation of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/47059-know-nominee-deb-haaland-secretary-interior\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDeb Haaland\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e as Secretary of the Interior \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eConfirmed 50-41.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTuesday after 12pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCloture motion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the nomination of \u003ca Nominees\",\"id\":47043,\"slug\":\"47043-house-take-covid-relief-senate-consider-cabinet-nominees\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/47043-house-take-covid-relief-senate-consider-cabinet-nominees\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/47043-house-take-covid-relief-senate-consider-cabinet-nominees/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/47043/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is expected to vote this week on the final passage of the $1.9 trillion coronavirus (COVID-19) relief package, while the Senate works to confirm more of President Joe Biden’s Cabinet nominees.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week Tuesday with procedural votes on the nominations of Rep. Marcia Fudge (D-OH) to be secretary of housing and urban development and Judge Merrick Garland to be attorney general. If the procedural votes succeed, the nominees will be confirmed on Wednesday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAfter the Senate completes its work on those two nominations, it will take a procedural vote on the nomination of Michael Regan to be administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.help.senate.gov/hearings/examining-our-covid-19-response-an-update-from-the-frontlines\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCOVID-19 response\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.banking.senate.gov/hearings/who-wins-on-wall-street-gamestop-robinhood-and-the-state-of-retail-investing\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGamestop and retail investing\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, along with \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.epw.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/hearings?ID=B26712B4-FE3B-4259-A3C6-82FDCA9B9949\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eclimate change in the electricity secto\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003er.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House starts its week on Monday and is expected to be in session for votes through Thursday. As early as Tuesday, the House will take up the Senate’s amended version of the $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, the House will vote on a pair of bills to strengthen background checks in firearm purchases, along with a bill to increase union membership and prevent the misclassification of employees as contractors.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/hearings?ID=B16EB790-1F10-4A38-B03F-D1B37DF3E2BD\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBiden administration’s foreign policy with Secretary of State Antony Blinken\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the \u003ca href=\\\"https://smallbusiness.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=3582\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePaycheck Protection Program for small businesses\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://agriculture.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=2126\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003efood insecurity in America\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/80165c/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/80165c/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/80165c/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/80165c/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/80165c/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":481,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 3.11.21\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is expected to vote this week on the final passage of the $1.9 trillion coronavirus (COVID-19) relief package, while the Senate works to confirm more of President Joe Biden’s Cabinet nominees. \u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week Tuesday with procedural votes on the nominations of Rep. Marcia Fudge (D-OH) to be secretary of housing and urban development and Judge Merrick Garland to be attorney general. If the procedural votes succeed, the nominees will be confirmed on Wednesday.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAfter the Senate completes its work on those two nominations, it will take a procedural vote on the nomination of Michael Regan to be administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.help.senate.gov/hearings/examining-our-covid-19-response-an-update-from-the-frontlines\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCOVID-19 response\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.banking.senate.gov/hearings/who-wins-on-wall-street-gamestop-robinhood-and-the-state-of-retail-investing\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGamestop and retail investing\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, along with \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.epw.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/hearings?ID=B26712B4-FE3B-4259-A3C6-82FDCA9B9949\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eclimate change in the electricity secto\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003er.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House starts its week on Monday and is expected to be in session for votes through Thursday. As early as Tuesday, the House will take up the Senate’s amended version of the $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, the House will vote on a pair of bills to strengthen background checks in firearm purchases, along with a bill to increase union membership and prevent the misclassification of employees as contractors.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/hearings?ID=B16EB790-1F10-4A38-B03F-D1B37DF3E2BD\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBiden administration’s foreign policy with Secretary of State Antony Blinken\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the \u003ca href=\\\"https://smallbusiness.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=3582\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePaycheck Protection Program for small businesses\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://agriculture.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=2126\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003efood insecurity in America\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"comment_count\":64,\"issue_slugs\":[\"congress-shenanigans\",\"upcoming-bills\"],\"created_at\":\"2021-03-07T15:26:12.544Z\",\"status\":\"published\",\"snippet\":\"What’s happening in Congress?The House is expected to vote this week on the final passage of the $1.9 trillion coronavirus\",\"html_byline\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 3.11.21\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":2,\"reaction_config\":[{\"icon\":\"excited\",\"color\":\"#EE4950\",\"stance\":\"excited\"},{\"icon\":\"happy\",\"color\":\"#EDB723\",\"stance\":\"happy\"},{\"icon\":\"apathetic\",\"color\":\"#3AB093\",\"stance\":\"apathetic\"},{\"icon\":\"sad\",\"color\":\"#5ACDED\",\"stance\":\"sad\"},{\"icon\":\"angry\",\"color\":\"#624960\",\"stance\":\"angry\"}],\"reaction_config_id\":1,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2021-03-11T23:15:13.120Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"3.11.21\",\"issue_ids\":[\"congress-shenanigans\",\"upcoming-bills\"]},{\"title\":\"Senate to Take Up Democrats’ $1.9 Trillion COVID Bill, House to Vote on Reforms to Elections \u0026 Policing\",\"id\":47010,\"slug\":\"47010-senate-take-democrats-1-9-trillion-covid-bill-house-vote-reforms-elections-policing\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/47010-senate-take-democrats-1-9-trillion-covid-bill-house-vote-reforms-elections-policing\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/47010-senate-take-democrats-1-9-trillion-covid-bill-house-vote-reforms-elections-policing/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/47010/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is expected to take up Democrats’ $1.9 trillion coronavirus (COVID-19) spending package this week, while the House is set to vote on Democrats’ bills to reform elections and policing.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week Monday with a confirmation vote on the nomination of Miguel Cardona to be secretary of education, followed by a procedural vote on Rhode Island Governor Gina Raimondo’s (D) nomination to be secretary of commerce. A confirmation vote on Raimondo’s nomination will likely follow on Tuesday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eOnce the Senate concludes its work on nominations for the week, it will take up Democrats’ $1.9 trillion spending bill that passed the House along party-lines early Saturday morning, which will be the chamber’s focus for the rest of the week.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eUnder the rules of reconciliation, the Senate will hold up to 20 hours of debate on the package before proceeding to a “vote-a-rama” in which senators will be able to freely offer amendments to the package. The $15 minimum wage included in the House bill will be removed as a violation of parliamentary rules, although Democrats may attempt to reconfigure the provision in a last-ditch bid to include it.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe timing of the Senate’s passage vote will depend on whether any debate time is yielded back and how long the vote-a-rama takes, but it will likely occur at the end of the week. If the Senate passes an amended version of the bill as expected, the package will go back to the House for reconsideration.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/examining-the-january-6-attack-on-the-us-capitol-part-ii\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCapitol riot\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e; \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/gaos-2021-high-risk-list-addressing-waste-fraud-and-abuse\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ewaste, fraud, and abuse\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e in federal programs; \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.armed-services.senate.gov/hearings/21-03-02-global-security-challenges-and-strategy\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eglobal security challenges\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e; and the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.banking.senate.gov//hearings/wall-street-vs-workers-how-the-financial-system-hurts-workers-and-widens-the-racial-wealth-gap\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eracial wealth gap\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House starts its week Monday, when the Rules Committee will meet to prepare a rule for debate on a pair of bills that are expected to be the focus of the week ― the For the People Act election reform package and the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act police reform bill.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Rules Committee will determine whether any amendments to the bills can be debated and voted on when they reach the floor, and the House may vote on the rule Monday to set up floor consideration of the two bills during the course of the week. The House is expected to conclude its work week on Thursday.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://appropriations.house.gov/events/hearings/us-capitol-police-fy-2022-budget-hearing\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCapitol Police budget\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e; \u003ca href=\\\"https://oversight.house.gov/legislation/hearings/on-the-2021-gao-high-risk-list-blueprint-for-a-safer-stronger-more-effective\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ewaste, fraud, and abuse\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e in federal programs; and a \u003ca href=\\\"https://naturalresources.house.gov/hearings/discussion-on-the-insular-area-climate-change-act\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003edraft climate change bill\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 6:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003ePossible vote on the rule for H.R. 1 and H.R. 1280\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTuesday after \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePassed Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"user_id\":795,\"cta_prompt\":\"How do you feel about this week’s congressional schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/942fdb/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/942fdb/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/942fdb/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/942fdb/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/942fdb/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":960,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 3.6.21\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is expected to take up Democrats’ $1.9 trillion coronavirus (COVID-19) spending package this week, while the House is set to vote on Democrats’ bills to reform elections and policing. \u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week Monday with a confirmation vote on the nomination of Miguel Cardona to be secretary of education, followed by a procedural vote on Rhode Island Governor Gina Raimondo’s (D) nomination to be secretary of commerce. A confirmation vote on Raimondo’s nomination will likely follow on Tuesday.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eOnce the Senate concludes its work on nominations for the week, it will take up Democrats’ $1.9 trillion spending bill that passed the House along party-lines early Saturday morning, which will be the chamber’s focus for the rest of the week. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eUnder the rules of reconciliation, the Senate will hold up to 20 hours of debate on the package before proceeding to a “vote-a-rama” in which senators will be able to freely offer amendments to the package. The $15 minimum wage included in the House bill will be removed as a violation of parliamentary rules, although Democrats may attempt to reconfigure the provision in a last-ditch bid to include it.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe timing of the Senate’s passage vote will depend on whether any debate time is yielded back and how long the vote-a-rama takes, but it will likely occur at the end of the week. If the Senate passes an amended version of the bill as expected, the package will go back to the House for reconsideration.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/examining-the-january-6-attack-on-the-us-capitol-part-ii\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCapitol riot\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e; \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/gaos-2021-high-risk-list-addressing-waste-fraud-and-abuse\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ewaste, fraud, and abuse\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e in federal programs; \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.armed-services.senate.gov/hearings/21-03-02-global-security-challenges-and-strategy\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eglobal security challenges\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e; and the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.banking.senate.gov//hearings/wall-street-vs-workers-how-the-financial-system-hurts-workers-and-widens-the-racial-wealth-gap\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eracial wealth gap\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House starts its week Monday, when the Rules Committee will meet to prepare a rule for debate on a pair of bills that are expected to be the focus of the week ― the For the People Act election reform package and the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act police reform bill.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Rules Committee will determine whether any amendments to the bills can be debated and voted on when they reach the floor, and the House may vote on the rule Monday to set up floor consideration of the two bills during the course of the week. The House is expected to conclude its work week on Thursday.  \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://appropriations.house.gov/events/hearings/us-capitol-police-fy-2022-budget-hearing\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCapitol Police budget\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e; \u003ca href=\\\"https://oversight.house.gov/legislation/hearings/on-the-2021-gao-high-risk-list-blueprint-for-a-safer-stronger-more-effective\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ewaste, fraud, and abuse\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e in federal programs; and a \u003ca href=\\\"https://naturalresources.house.gov/hearings/discussion-on-the-insular-area-climate-change-act\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003edraft climate change bill\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 6:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003ePossible vote on the rule for H.R. 1 and H.R. 1280\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTuesday after expected.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 5:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eConfirmation of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46987-know-nominee-miguel-cardona-secretary-education\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMiguel Cardona\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e as Secretary of Education happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eCongress returns from recess this week with the House expected to take up Democrats’ coronavirus (COVID-19) relief package and the Senate set to confirm more nominees to President Joe Biden’s Cabinet.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week Monday with a procedural vote on the nomination of Linda Thomas-Greenfield to be U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations, which will set up a likely confirmation vote on Tuesday or Wednesday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIt will also vote Tuesday on the confirmation of Tom Vilsack to be secretary of agriculture. Additional confirmation votes may occur later in the week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the nominations of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/the-nomination-of-the-honorable-merrick-brian-garland-to-be-attorney-general-of-the-united-states\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMerrick Garland\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to be \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/the-nomination-of-the-honorable-merrick-brian-garland-to-be-attorney-general-of-the-united-states-day-2\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eattorney general\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.energy.senate.gov/hearings/2021/2/hearing-to-consider-nomination-of-the-honorable-debra-haaland-to-be-the-secretary-of-the-interior\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDeb Haaland to be secretary of the interior\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.help.senate.gov/hearings/nomination-of-xavier-becerra-to-serve-as-secretary-of-health-and-human-services\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eXavier Becerra to be secretary of health and human services\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.intelligence.senate.gov/hearings/open-hearing-nomination-ambassador-william-burns-be-director-central-intelligence-agency\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWilliam Burns to be director of the CIA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e; in addition to the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.armed-services.senate.gov/hearings/21-02-23-emerging-technologies-and-their-impact-on-national-security\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eimpact of emerging technologies on national security\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House starts its week Tuesday with votes on six bipartisan bills under the fast-track “suspension of the rules” process that requires a two-thirds majority for passage.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eLater in the week, it will vote on a bill to designate gender identity and sexual orientation as “protected classes” under civil rights law, in addition to a bill to designate nearly 1.5 million acres of land in California, Colorado, and Washington as wilderness.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is also expected to take up Democrats’ COVID-19 relief package through the reconciliation process. The bill will be marked up by the Budget Committee on Monday, and will likely reach the House floor at the end of the week, potentially during next weekend.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://financialservices.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=407168\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003emonetary policy and the state of the economy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/hearings?ID=890324DD-9AB8-4632-8476-451915623508\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eU.S. foreign policy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and proposals to put the \u003ca href=\\\"https://oversight.house.gov/legislation/hearings/legislative-proposals-to-put-the-postal-service-on-sustainable-financial\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eU.S. Postal Service on sustainable financial footing\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 2.27.21\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eCongress returns from recess this week with the House expected to take up Democrats’ coronavirus (COVID-19) relief package and the Senate set to confirm more nominees to President Joe Biden’s Cabinet.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week Monday with a procedural vote on the nomination of Linda Thomas-Greenfield to be U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations, which will set up a likely confirmation vote on Tuesday or Wednesday.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIt will also vote Tuesday on the confirmation of Tom Vilsack to be secretary of agriculture. Additional confirmation votes may occur later in the week.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the nominations of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/the-nomination-of-the-honorable-merrick-brian-garland-to-be-attorney-general-of-the-united-states\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMerrick Garland\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to be \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/the-nomination-of-the-honorable-merrick-brian-garland-to-be-attorney-general-of-the-united-states-day-2\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eattorney general\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.energy.senate.gov/hearings/2021/2/hearing-to-consider-nomination-of-the-honorable-debra-haaland-to-be-the-secretary-of-the-interior\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDeb Haaland to be secretary of the interior\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.help.senate.gov/hearings/nomination-of-xavier-becerra-to-serve-as-secretary-of-health-and-human-services\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eXavier Becerra to be secretary of health and human services\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.intelligence.senate.gov/hearings/open-hearing-nomination-ambassador-william-burns-be-director-central-intelligence-agency\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWilliam Burns to be director of the CIA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e; in addition to the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.armed-services.senate.gov/hearings/21-02-23-emerging-technologies-and-their-impact-on-national-security\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eimpact of emerging technologies on national security\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House starts its week Tuesday with votes on six bipartisan bills under the fast-track “suspension of the rules” process that requires a two-thirds majority for passage.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eLater in the week, it will vote on a bill to designate gender identity and sexual orientation as “protected classes” under civil rights law, in addition to a bill to designate nearly 1.5 million acres of land in California, Colorado, and Washington as wilderness.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House is also expected to take up Democrats’ COVID-19 relief package through the reconciliation process. The bill will be marked up by the Budget Committee on Monday, and will likely reach the House floor at the end of the week, potentially during next weekend.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://financialservices.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=407168\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003emonetary policy and the state of the economy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/hearings?ID=890324DD-9AB8-4632-8476-451915623508\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eU.S. foreign policy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and proposals to put the \u003ca href=\\\"https://oversight.house.gov/legislation/hearings/legislative-proposals-to-put-the-postal-service-on-sustainable-financial\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eU.S. Postal Service on sustainable financial footing\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. Bill\",\"id\":46877,\"slug\":\"46877-senate-begin-trump-s-second-impeachment-trial-committees-start-drafting-reconciliation-bill\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46877-senate-begin-trump-s-second-impeachment-trial-committees-start-drafting-reconciliation-bill\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46877-senate-begin-trump-s-second-impeachment-trial-committees-start-drafting-reconciliation-bill/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46877/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is set to begin the second impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump this week, on the charge of “incitement of insurrection.”\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eOff the floor, committees in both chambers of Congress will start the process of drafting coronavirus (COVID-19) relief legislation that’s expected to be considered in late February and early March.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eAfter the Senate convenes Monday, it will take a vote on the confirmation of Denis McDonough as Secretary of Veterans Affairs.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eFollowing the confirmation vote, the Senate will transition into a parliamentary posture that allows it to sit as a court of impeachment, with the first full day of proceedings in Trump’s second impeachment trial to begin on Tuesday.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eOnce the impeachment trial begins, the Senate is required to continue the trial every day (except for Sundays). There may be procedural votes related to the trial that occur during proceedings, such as on motions to dismiss the trial or to call witnesses.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIt’s possible that the Senate will consider additional legislation or nominations while the impeachment trial is ongoing, but that is unlikely because unanimous consent would be required to hold those votes.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold nominations\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e of Miguel Cardona to be Secretary of Education and Marty Walsh to be Secretary of Labor, in addition to a \u003ca Neera Tanden to be Director of the Office of Management and Budget\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE participating in virtual committee hearings,\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/b2ea62/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/b2ea62/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/b2ea62/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/b2ea62/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/b2ea62/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":822,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 2.8.21\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is set to begin the second impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump this week, on the charge of “incitement of insurrection.” \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eOff the floor, committees in both chambers of Congress will start the process of drafting coronavirus (COVID-19) relief legislation that’s expected to be considered in late February and early March. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAfter the Senate convenes Monday, it will take a vote on the confirmation of Denis McDonough as Secretary of Veterans Affairs.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eFollowing the confirmation vote, the Senate will transition into a parliamentary posture that allows it to sit as a court of impeachment, with the first full day of proceedings in Trump’s second impeachment trial to begin on Tuesday. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eOnce the impeachment trial begins, the Senate is required to continue the trial every day (except for Sundays). There may be procedural votes related to the trial that occur during proceedings, such as on motions to dismiss the trial or to call witnesses. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIt’s possible that the Senate will consider additional legislation or nominations while the impeachment trial is ongoing, but that is unlikely because unanimous consent would be required to hold those votes.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.help.senate.gov/hearings/nominations021121\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eadvance the nominations\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e of Miguel Cardona to be Secretary of Education and Marty Walsh to be Secretary of Labor, in addition to a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/nomination-of-neera-tanden-to-be-director-office-of-management-and-budget\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003epair\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.budget.senate.gov/omb-nomination-hearing-of-ms-neera-tanden-\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003econfirmation hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e for Neera Tanden to be Director of the Office of Management and Budget\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House is on recess and will not convene for any votes this week, as members are back in their districts and participating in virtual committee hearings, \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the \u003ca href=\\\"https://edlabor.house.gov/hearings/committee-print-to-comply-with-reconciliation-directives-included-in-section-2001-b-of-the-concurrent-resolutions-on-the-budget-for-fiscal-year-2021-hconres-11-and-sconres-5\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ebudget reconciliation directives from Democrats’ budget resolution\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://homeland.house.gov/activities/hearings/homeland-cybersecurity-assessing-cyber-threats-and-building-resilience\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eassessing cyber threats to the homeland\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://budget.house.gov/legislation/hearings/consideration-rules-committee-budget-117th-congress\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow coronavirus (COVID-19) relief package using the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46850-democrats-use-budget-reconciliation\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ebudget reconciliation process\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is also expected to vote on the confirmation of at least two of President Joe Biden’s Cabinet nominees, as it prepares to start the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46816-schumer-signals-february-8th-start-date-second-trump-impeachment-trial\\\" 8th.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is expected to vote Monday on the confirmation of Alejandro Mayorkas, Biden’s nominee to be Secretary of Homeland Security, followed by a Tuesday vote on the nomination of Pete Buttigieg to be Secretary of Transportation.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eSenate Democrats are expected to advance a budget resolution containing reconciliation instructions. As part of the process, the Senate will hold a “vote-a-rama” on amendments to the budget resolution, although the timing depends on when the chamber begins debate on the underlying bill.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is expected to convene on Tuesday and work through Friday, although it’s possible the chamber may be in session over the weekend to vote on a budget resolution if the Senate passes a different version of the legislation.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAt a time to be announced, the House is expected to consider a budget resolution for FY2021 with reconciliation directives. The House may vote on its own version of the budget resolution, it may take the Senate’s version up directly, or it may end up voting a second time on the budget resolution if different versions pass the House and Senate.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAside from the budget resolution, the House is expected to vote on a bill to expand the registered apprenticeship program at the Dept. of Labor. Additional items may be added to the legislative schedule throughout the week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to organize themselves for the 117th Congress, in addition to the \u003ca href=\\\"https://financialservices.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=407097\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eneed for additional coronavirus stimulus\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and the \u003ca href=\\\"https://smallbusiness.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=3501\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003estate of small businesses in the COVID-19 era\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. of former President Donald Trump\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on February 8th.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE containing reconciliation instructions. labor\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.veterans.senate.gov/hearings/business-meeting\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003esecretary of veterans affairs\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.epw.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/hearings?ID=D825A7BE-3D52-4651-9664-A373EB3699A5\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEPA administrator\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House is expected to convene on Tuesday and work through Friday, although it’s possible the chamber may be in session over the weekend to vote on a budget resolution if the Senate passes a different version of the legislation.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAt a time to be announced, the House is expected to consider a budget resolution for FY2021 with reconciliation directives. The House may vote on its own version of the budget resolution, it may take the Senate’s version up directly, or it may end up voting a second time on the budget resolution if different versions pass the House and Senate.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAside from the budget resolution, the House is expected to vote on a bill to expand the registered apprenticeship program at the Dept. of Labor. Additional items may be added to the legislative schedule throughout the week.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to organize themselves for the 117th Congress, in addition to the \u003ca href=\\\"https://financialservices.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=407097\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eneed for additional coronavirus stimulus\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and the \u003ca href=\\\"https://smallbusiness.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=3501\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003estate of small businesses in the COVID-19 era\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003cem\u003ePro forma\u003c/em\u003e session, no votes are expected.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTuesday after 2pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eDebating and adopting the rule for the budget resolution and apprenticeship bill.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWednesday after 1pm \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hconres11-117\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.Con.Res. 11\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Budget Resolution to Use Reconciliation for $1.9 Trillion in COVID Relief \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eAdopted 218-212.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThursday after 12pm \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hres72-117\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.Res. 72\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Removing Rep. happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is set to spend the week confirming more of President Joe Biden’s Cabinet nominees. Last week, the Senate confirmed \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46804-know-nominee-avril-haines-director-national-intelligence\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDirector of National Intelligence Avril Haines\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46810-know-nominee-lloyd-austin-secretary-defense\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSecretary of Defense Lloyd Austin\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIt will also take procedural steps to prepare for \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46816-schumer-signals-february-8th-start-date-second-trump-impeachment-trial\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003enext month’s impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e after the House transmits the article of impeachment.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate will vote on the confirmation of Janet Yellen to serve as Secretary of the Treasury on Monday evening. The Senate Foreign Relations Committee is expected to advance the nomination of Antony Blinken to serve as Secretary of State, ahead of a possible confirmation vote as early as Tuesday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, the Senate will receive the article of impeachment against former President Trump on Monday, which will allow impeachment managers and the president’s counsel to be sworn on Tuesday. The legal teams will then prepare for the beginning of the impeachment trial on Monday, February 8th.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the nominations of Gina Raimondo to be Secretary of Commerce, Jennifer Granholm to be Secretary of Energy, Linda Thomas-Greenfield to be Ambassador to the United Nations, Denis McDonough to be Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and Rep. Marcia Fudge (D-OH) to be Secretary of Housing and Urban Affairs.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNo votes are expected on the House floor this week, as members are on a “district work period.” The chamber is scheduled to return from recess next week, with floor votes possible on Tuesday, February 2nd.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eSeveral \u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to organize their membership and procedures for the 117th Congress, and a hearing will be held on COVID-19 safety for public transportation workers and passengers.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 1.29.21\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is set to spend the week confirming more of President Joe Biden’s Cabinet nominees. Last week, the Senate confirmed \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46804-know-nominee-avril-haines-director-national-intelligence\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDirector of National Intelligence Avril Haines\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46810-know-nominee-lloyd-austin-secretary-defense\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSecretary of Defense Lloyd Austin\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIt will also take procedural steps to prepare for \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46816-schumer-signals-february-8th-start-date-second-trump-impeachment-trial\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003enext month’s impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e after the House transmits the article of impeachment.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate will vote on the confirmation of Janet Yellen to serve as Secretary of the Treasury on Monday evening. The Senate Foreign Relations Committee is expected to advance the nomination of Antony Blinken to serve as Secretary of State, ahead of a possible confirmation vote as early as Tuesday.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, the Senate will receive the article of impeachment against former President Trump on Monday, which will allow impeachment managers and the president’s counsel to be sworn on Tuesday. The legal teams will then prepare for the beginning of the impeachment trial on Monday, February 8th.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the nominations of Gina Raimondo to be Secretary of Commerce, Jennifer Granholm to be Secretary of Energy, Linda Thomas-Greenfield to be Ambassador to the United Nations, Denis McDonough to be Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and Rep. Marcia Fudge (D-OH) to be Secretary of Housing and Urban Affairs.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eNo votes are expected on the House floor this week, as members are on a “district work period.” The chamber is scheduled to return from recess next week, with floor votes possible on Tuesday, February 2nd. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eSeveral \u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to organize their membership and procedures for the 117th Congress, and a hearing will be held on COVID-19 safety for public transportation workers and passengers.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNo votes are expected.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 5:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eConfirmation vote on the nomination of \u003ca happening in Congress?\\nThe Senate is set to spend the week confirming more of President Joe Biden’s Cabinet nominees.\",\"html_byline\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca 1.29.21\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":4,\"reaction_config\":[{\"icon\":\"excited\",\"color\":\"#EE4950\",\"stance\":\"excited\"},{\"icon\":\"happy\",\"color\":\"#EDB723\",\"stance\":\"happy\"},{\"icon\":\"apathetic\",\"color\":\"#3AB093\",\"stance\":\"apathetic\"},{\"icon\":\"sad\",\"color\":\"#5ACDED\",\"stance\":\"sad\"},{\"icon\":\"angry\",\"color\":\"#624960\",\"stance\":\"angry\"}],\"reaction_config_id\":1,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2021-01-29T17:45:41.299Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"1.29.21\",\"issue_ids\":[\"congress-shenanigans\",\"upcoming-bills\"]},{\"title\":\"Senate to Hold Confirmation Hearings for Biden Cabinet Nominees, Potentially Begin Impeachment Trial\",\"id\":46782,\"slug\":\"46782-senate-hold-confirmation-hearings-biden-cabinet-nominees-potentially-begin-impeachment-trial\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46782-senate-hold-confirmation-hearings-biden-cabinet-nominees-potentially-begin-impeachment-trial\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46782-senate-hold-confirmation-hearings-biden-cabinet-nominees-potentially-begin-impeachment-trial/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46782/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eBoth chambers of Congress are set to return to the Capitol this week for a work period that will be shortened by the observance of Martin Luther King, Jr. Day on Monday, and punctuated by the Inauguration Day festivities and the swearing-in ceremonies for President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris on Wednesday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eCommittees are expected to hold the first confirmation hearings for Biden’s Cabinet nominations, and floor votes on their confirmation may occur in the Senate.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIt’s still unclear whether House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) intends to send the article of impeachment against President Donald Trump to the Senate, which would trigger a trial beginning the next business day.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate’s floor schedule for the week ahead is yet to be announced, although it could be occupied by an impeachment trial of President Donald Trump if Pelosi transmits the article of impeachment to the Senate. If she does, the Senate may try to structure a unanimous consent agreement that allows legislative and executive business to occur on the same day as proceedings in the trial.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAside from the prospect of the impeachment trial, the Senate may consider an organizing resolution to establish procedures for dealing with committee work and other matters in a 50-50 Senate.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold confirmation hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on Tuesday the nominations of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.finance.senate.gov/hearings/hearing-to-consider-the-anticipated-nomination-of-to-be-the-honorable-janet-l-yellen-to-secretary-of-the-treasury\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJanet Yellen to be Treasury Secretary\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.intelligence.senate.gov/hearings/open-hearing-nomination-avril-haines-be-director-national-intelligence\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAvril Haines to be Director of National Intelligence\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/nomination-of-the-honorable-alejandro-n-mayorkas-to-be-secretary-us-department-of-homeland-security\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAlejandro Mayorkas to be Secretary of Homeland Security\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.foreign.senate.gov/hearings/nominations-011921\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAntony Blinken to be Secretary of State\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.armed-services.senate.gov/hearings/21-01-19-nomination\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLloyd Austin to be Secretary of Defense\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. A confirmation hearing for \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.commerce.senate.gov/2021/1/ni\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePete Buttigieg to be Secretary of Transportation\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e will occur on Thursday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is expected to meet for a brief work week with votes on Thursday and Friday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eWhile it’s unclear as of the weekend what legislation will be on the floor, the House may take up legislation to grant a waiver for Biden’s defense secretary nominee, Lloyd Austin, to serve in the role given that he hasn’t been retired from active service for the minimum amount of time.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House Armed Services Committee will hold an organizational hearing prior to a hearing on \u003ca href=\\\"https://armedservices.house.gov/press-releases?ID=70766382-B671-4CB6-9947-158FB3E9F5C0\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecivilian control of the military and a waiver for Lloyd Austin\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to serve as Secretary of Defense.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. Again\",\"id\":46764,\"slug\":\"46764-house-call-25th-amendment-invoked-impeach-president-trump\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46764-house-call-25th-amendment-invoked-impeach-president-trump\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46764-house-call-25th-amendment-invoked-impeach-president-trump/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46764/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is expected to spend this week pursuing the removal of President Donald Trump through two mechanisms ― the 25th Amendment and impeachment.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eAfter a \u003cem\u003epro forma \u003c/em\u003esession on Monday, the House will spend Tuesday considering a resolution calling for Vice President Mike Pence and the Cabinet to invoke the 25th Amendment to strip President Donald Trump of his authority.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eDemocratic leadership indicated that if Pence and the Cabinet don’t invoke the 25th Amendment within 24 hours of the above resolution’s adoption, the House will consider an article of impeachment against President Trump for “inciting insurrection” through his actions and remarks prior to the riot at the Capitol.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House’s consideration of the article of impeachment will likely occur Wednesday night, although that timing is subject to change. Its schedule for the rest of the week is yet to be announced, although a censure and expulsion resolutions could be brought to the floor.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is on recess this week and aside from \u003cem\u003epro forma\u003c/em\u003e sessions on Tuesday and Thursday at which no business will be considered. The next scheduled session where regular business will be conducted is expected to be Tuesday, January 19th.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf the House adopts an article of impeachment against President Donald Trump and the Senate is unable to reach unanimous consent to conduct business during a \u003cem\u003epro forma\u003c/em\u003e session, the Senate wouldn’t be able to begin a trial until Wednesday, January 20th at the earliest.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. 117th Congress Convenes for the First Time, House to Vote on Rules Package\",\"id\":46716,\"slug\":\"46716-117th-congress-convenes-time-house-vote-rules-package\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46716-117th-congress-convenes-time-house-vote-rules-package\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46716-117th-congress-convenes-time-house-vote-rules-package/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46716/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe 117th Congress convenes for the first time on Sunday, January 3, 2021, as lawmakers take their oaths of office and the leadership in both chambers prepares for the first votes of the new session.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eOn Wednesday, the House and Senate will hold a joint session to certify the state-by-state results of the Electoral College, which will formalize Joe Biden as president-elect. The joint session is expected to feature votes on whether to accept \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46700-hawley-first-senator-announce-plans-object-electoral-college-certification\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eobjections raised by Republicans\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, which are unlikely to be sustained by majorities of the House or Senate.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House convenes Sunday to hold a recorded quorum call, hold swearing-in ceremonies for members and delegates, and elect the speaker. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) is expected to retain her gavel, although she faces a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46709-pelosi-faces-narrow-path-retaining-speakership\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003enarrow margin for re-election and the voting may take several hours\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. If she doesn’t secure a majority on the first ballot, additional votes may be held.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eOn Monday, the House will consider the rules package for the 117th Congress, which sets the rules and procedures the House will use to conduct its business. Rules packages often include changes aimed at strengthening the position of the majority and making changes to House procedures that reflect partisan goals.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eDemocrats’ rules package would reduce the ability of the Republican minority to offer amendments through the motion to recommit; prohibit the use of gendered terms in all business; and extend the ability of members to vote by proxy.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eTuesday will feature votes on five bipartisan bills under the fast-track suspension of the rules process, including legislation to increase transparency about personnel actions taken against inspectors general; require disclosure of federal agency settlements in a public database; and standardize reporting of federal agency budget requests.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditional votes may be scheduled later in the week after Wednesday’s joint session of Congress to certify the Electoral College results.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate will meet Sunday to hold a quorum call and swear in newly-elected senators. Unlike the House, the Senate is a continuing body so the rules and precedents it used in the previous session carry over into the new Congress, and it doesn’t need to adopt a formal rules package.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAfter it completes its Sunday session, the Senate will adjourn until the joint session of Congress on Wednesday to certify the results of the Electoral College.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditional votes may be scheduled later in the week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSunday after 12pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eRecorded quorum call\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eSwearing-in members and delegates\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eHouse Speaker Election \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eHouse Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) - 216, \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003eMinority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) - 209, Sen. Tammy Duckworth - 1, Rep. Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY) - 1, Present - 3, (3 absences and 2 vacancies).\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 10am\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hres8-117\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.Res. 8\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Adopting the Rules of the House of Representatives for the 117th Congress \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eAdopted 217-206.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTuesday after 12pm \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003e(under \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/27672-suspension-rules-house\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003esuspension of the rules\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr22-117\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.R. 22\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Congressional Budget Justification Transparency Act of 2021 \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePassed 412-2.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr23-117\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.R. 23\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Inspector General Protection Act \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePassed by voice vote.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr27-117\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.R. 27\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Settlement Agreement Information Database Act of 2021 \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePassed by voice vote.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr21-117\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.R. 21\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: FedRAMP Authorization Act \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePassed by voice vote.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr26-117\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.R. 26\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Construction Consensus Procurement Improvement Act of 2021\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePassed by voice vote.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWednesday after 1pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eJoint Session to Certify the Electoral College Results\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRest of the Week\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eTo be
