schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/e93016/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/e93016/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/e93016/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/e93016/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/e93016/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":624,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 1.5.21\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe 117th Congress convenes for the first time on Sunday, January 3, 2021, as lawmakers take their oaths of office and the leadership in both chambers prepares for the first votes of the new session.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eOn Wednesday, the House and Senate will hold a joint session to certify the state-by-state results of the Electoral College, which will formalize Joe Biden as president-elect. The joint session is expected to feature votes on whether to accept \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46700-hawley-first-senator-announce-plans-object-electoral-college-certification\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eobjections raised by Republicans\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, which are unlikely to be sustained by majorities of the House or Senate.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House convenes Sunday to hold a recorded quorum call, hold swearing-in ceremonies for members and delegates, and elect the speaker. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) is expected to retain her gavel, although she faces a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46709-pelosi-faces-narrow-path-retaining-speakership\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003enarrow margin for re-election and the voting may take several hours\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. If she doesn’t secure a majority on the first ballot, additional votes may be held.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eOn Monday, the House will consider the rules package for the 117th Congress, which sets the rules and procedures the House will use to conduct its business. Rules packages often include changes aimed at strengthening the position of the majority and making changes to House procedures that reflect partisan goals.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eDemocrats’ rules package would reduce the ability of the Republican minority to offer amendments through the motion to recommit; prohibit the use of gendered terms in all business; and extend the ability of members to vote by proxy.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eTuesday will feature votes on five bipartisan bills under the fast-track suspension of the rules process, including legislation to increase transparency about personnel actions taken against inspectors general; require disclosure of federal agency settlements in a public database; and standardize reporting of federal agency budget requests.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditional votes may be scheduled later in the week after Wednesday’s joint session of Congress to certify the Electoral College results.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate will meet Sunday to hold a quorum call and swear in newly-elected senators. Unlike the House, the Senate is a continuing body so the rules and precedents it used in the previous session carry over into the new Congress, and it doesn’t need to adopt a formal rules package.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAfter it completes its Sunday session, the Senate will adjourn until the joint session of Congress on Wednesday to certify the results of the Electoral College.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditional votes may be scheduled later in the week.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSunday after 12pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eRecorded quorum call\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eSwearing-in members and delegates \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eHouse Speaker Election \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eHouse Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) - 216, \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003eMinority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) - 209, Sen. Tammy Duckworth - 1, Rep. Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY) - 1, Present - 3, (3 absences and 2 vacancies).\u003c/em\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 10am \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hres8-117\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.Res. 8\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Adopting the Rules of the House of Representatives for the 117th Congress \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eAdopted 217-206.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTuesday after 12pm \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003e(under \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/27672-suspension-rules-house\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003esuspension of the rules\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePassed 412-2.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr23-117\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.R. 23\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Inspector General Protection Act \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePassed by voice vote.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr27-117\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.R. 27\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: to Certify the Electoral College Results\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRest of the Week\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eTo be Bill\",\"id\":46687,\"slug\":\"46687-congress-attempt-override-president-trump-s-veto-defense-bill\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46687-congress-attempt-override-president-trump-s-veto-defense-bill\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46687-congress-attempt-override-president-trump-s-veto-defense-bill/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46687/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eCongress will convene this week to hold votes on \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46679-president-trump-vetoes-defense-bill-set-likely-override-congress\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eoverriding President Donald Trump’s veto of the annual defense authorization bill\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, if President Trump decides not to sign the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr133-116\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e$1.4 trillion omnibus spending bill and $900 billion coronavirus relief package\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, Congress will likely vote on legislation to avert or conclude a partial government shutdown that would begin at 11:59:59pm Eastern on Monday night if the legislation isn’t enacted. If the president vetoes the package, Congress may vote to override that veto as well.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThis week is the final week of the 116th Congress, as the 117th Congress is expected to be seated on Sunday, January 3, 2021 ― although lawmakers may still vote to move the first day of the new Congress back until Monday to avoid beginning the new session on a weekend.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House will convene Monday to vote on overriding President Trump’s veto of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr6395-116\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNational Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for FY2021\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, which will require a two-thirds majority to succeed. Trump \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46679-president-trump-vetoes-defense-bill-set-likely-override-congress\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003evetoed the defense package\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e last week, citing several concerns.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThere may be additional legislation considered by the House before it adjourns for the week, such as a short-term continuing resolution to fund the government into the new year and a bill to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46676-trump-calls-congress-increase-size-stimulus-checks-coronavirus-relief-bill\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eincrease the size of stimulus checks in the coronavirus relief package in line with President Trump’s request\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate will meet Tuesday and is expected to try to override the president’s veto of the NDAA if the House’s override vote succeeds.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditional votes on legislation to avoid or end a partial government shutdown or provide coronavirus relief are possible and could be announced in the next few days.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 1.1.21\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eCongress will convene this week to hold votes on \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46679-president-trump-vetoes-defense-bill-set-likely-override-congress\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eoverriding President Donald Trump’s veto of the annual defense authorization bill\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, if President Trump decides not to sign the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr133-116\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e$1.4 trillion omnibus spending bill and $900 billion coronavirus relief package\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, Congress will likely vote on legislation to avert or conclude a partial government shutdown that would begin at 11:59:59pm Eastern on Monday night if the legislation isn’t enacted. If the president vetoes the package, Congress may vote to override that veto as well.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThis week is the final week of the 116th Congress, as the 117th Congress is expected to be seated on Sunday, January 3, 2021 ― although lawmakers may still vote to move the first day of the new Congress back until Monday to avoid beginning the new session on a weekend.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House will convene Monday to vote on overriding President Trump’s veto of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr6395-116\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNational Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for FY2021\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, which will require a two-thirds majority to succeed. Trump \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46679-president-trump-vetoes-defense-bill-set-likely-override-congress\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003evetoed the defense package\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e last week, citing several concerns.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThere may be additional legislation considered by the House before it adjourns for the week, such as a short-term continuing resolution to fund the government into the new year and a bill to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46676-trump-calls-congress-increase-size-stimulus-checks-coronavirus-relief-bill\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eincrease the size of stimulus checks in the coronavirus relief package in line with President Trump’s request\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate will meet Tuesday and is expected to try to override the president’s veto of the NDAA if the House’s override vote succeeds.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditional votes on legislation to avoid or end a partial government shutdown or provide coronavirus relief are possible and could be announced in the next few days.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 6:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr9051-116\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.R. 9051\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: CASH Act \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePassed 275-134.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eOverriding the veto of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hr6395-116\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.R. 6395\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: William M. “Mac” Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePassed 322-87.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRest of the Week\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eTo be announced.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNo votes are expected, \u003cem\u003epro forma\u003c/em\u003e session.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTuesday\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNo scheduled.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFriday\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca Looks to Avoid a Gov’t Shutdown (Again) \u0026 Reach a Deal on COVID-19 Relief\",\"id\":46637,\"slug\":\"46637-congress-looks-avoid-gov-t-shutdown-reach-deal-covid-19-relief\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46637-congress-looks-avoid-gov-t-shutdown-reach-deal-covid-19-relief\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46637-congress-looks-avoid-gov-t-shutdown-reach-deal-covid-19-relief/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46637/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eCongress begins this week in a very similar position to last week ― facing a deadline of midnight Friday to pass legislation funding the government to avoid a partial shutdown while also trying to negotiate an elusive deal on coronavirus (COVID-19) relief. Votes on either package likely won’t be scheduled until deals are reached.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eLawmakers are hoping to reach an agreement on an omnibus spending package that would fund the government through the rest of fiscal year 2021, although passing another short-term continuing resolution is a fallback option.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eLeaders in both parties have said that Congress shouldn’t adjourn for the year without enacting COVID-19 relief legislation, so it’s possible that this week’s session may continue through the weekend or into next week.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate convenes on Monday for a procedural vote on the nomination of Thomas Kirsch II to serve as an appellate judge on the Seventh Circuit Court of Appeals. If confirmed, Kirsch would fill the vacancy created by the elevation of Supreme Court Associate Justice Amy Coney Barrett.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) took procedural steps to allow for the consideration of Katherine Crytzer’s nomination to be a judge for the Eastern District of Tennessee.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/examining-irregularities-in-the-2020-election\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eirregularities in the 2020 election\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.banking.senate.gov/hearings/us-china-winning-the-economic-competition-part-ii\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAmerica’s economic competition with China\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.finance.senate.gov/hearings/the-alzheimers-crisis-examining-testing-and-treatment-pipelines-and-fiscal-implications\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003etesting and treatment pipelines in the Alzheimer’s crisis\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eMajority Leader Steny Hoyer (D-MD) indicated that the earliest votes may be on Tuesday if deals on government funding or coronavirus relief are reached and that the House won’t convene until agreements on those packages are reached.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eHoyer indicated that the schedule “could be very fluid” and that members are “urged to keep their schedules flexible” for when votes are scheduled.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday (12/14) after schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/af58f6/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/af58f6/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/af58f6/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/af58f6/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/af58f6/This%20Week%20In%20Congress%20%282%29.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":464,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 12.22.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eCongress begins this week in a very similar position to last week ― facing a deadline of midnight Friday to pass legislation funding the government to avoid a partial shutdown while also trying to negotiate an elusive deal on coronavirus (COVID-19) relief. Votes on either package likely won’t be scheduled until deals are reached. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eLawmakers are hoping to reach an agreement on an omnibus spending package that would fund the government through the rest of fiscal year 2021, although passing another short-term continuing resolution is a fallback option. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eLeaders in both parties have said that Congress shouldn’t adjourn for the year without enacting COVID-19 relief legislation, so it’s possible that this week’s session may continue through the weekend or into next week. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate convenes on Monday for a procedural vote on the nomination of Thomas Kirsch II to serve as an appellate judge on the Seventh Circuit Court of Appeals. If confirmed, Kirsch would fill the vacancy created by the elevation of Supreme Court Associate Justice Amy Coney Barrett.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) took procedural steps to allow for the consideration of Katherine Crytzer’s nomination to be a judge for the Eastern District of Tennessee.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/examining-irregularities-in-the-2020-election\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eirregularities in the 2020 election\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.banking.senate.gov/hearings/us-china-winning-the-economic-competition-part-ii\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAmerica’s economic competition with China\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.finance.senate.gov/hearings/the-alzheimers-crisis-examining-testing-and-treatment-pipelines-and-fiscal-implications\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003etesting and treatment pipelines in the Alzheimer’s crisis\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eMajority Leader Steny Hoyer (D-MD) indicated that the earliest votes may be on Tuesday if deals on government funding or coronavirus relief are reached and that the House won’t convene until agreements on those packages are reached.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eHoyer indicated that the schedule “could be very fluid” and that members are “urged to keep their schedules flexible” for when votes are scheduled.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday (12/14) after 5:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow happening in Congress?\\nCongress begins this week in a very similar position to last week ― facing a deadline of midnight\",\"html_byline\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 12.22.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":3,\"reaction_config\":[{\"icon\":\"excited\",\"color\":\"#EE4950\",\"stance\":\"excited\"},{\"icon\":\"happy\",\"color\":\"#EDB723\",\"stance\":\"happy\"},{\"icon\":\"apathetic\",\"color\":\"#3AB093\",\"stance\":\"apathetic\"},{\"icon\":\"sad\",\"color\":\"#5ACDED\",\"stance\":\"sad\"},{\"icon\":\"angry\",\"color\":\"#624960\",\"stance\":\"angry\"}],\"reaction_config_id\":1,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-12-22T05:10:13.654Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"12.22.20\",\"issue_ids\":[\"congress-shenanigans\",\"upcoming-bills\"]},{\"title\":\"Congress Looks to Avoid a Partial Government Shutdown \u0026 Approve Coronavirus Relief\",\"id\":46612,\"slug\":\"46612-congress-looks-avoid-partial-government-shutdown-approve-coronavirus-relief\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46612-congress-looks-avoid-partial-government-shutdown-approve-coronavirus-relief\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46612-congress-looks-avoid-partial-government-shutdown-approve-coronavirus-relief/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46612/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eCongress convenes this week facing a deadline of midnight Friday to enact legislation funding the government and avoid a partial shutdown from occurring. It’s unclear whether that will take the form of a short-term continuing resolution (CR) or a larger omnibus package that funds the government for the remainder of fiscal year 2021.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eMembers are also hoping to finalize a coronavirus (COVID-19) relief package before the lame duck session ends. Additionally, Congress is expected to approve the annual defense authorization bill this week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAs of Sunday, lawmakers haven’t finalized the legislative text of legislation to fund the government or a COVID-19 deal, although negotiations on both fronts are expected to continue.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week Monday by considering the nomination of a federal claims court judge. Once it concludes consideration of that nomination on Tuesday, it will move on to the nomination of a member of the Federal Communications Commission.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe rest of the Senate’s agenda this week is yet to be announced, but the chamber is expected to consider government funding legislation and the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) before the end of the week.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is scheduled to be in session next week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/early-outpatient-treatment-an-essential-part-of-a-covid-19-solution-part-ii\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eoutpatient treatment for COVID-19\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the future of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sbc.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/hearings?ID=FC8E242C-B966-4C5A-AD3C-83E17DDE6704\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePaycheck Protection Program for small businesses\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/12/10/2020/executive-business-meeting\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ereforming liability protections for social media companies\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House begins its week with Monday votes on a series of bipartisan bills related to foreign policy and preventing student loan scams. Tuesday will feature a vote on the NDAA and more relatively bipartisan bills.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eOn Wednesday or Thursday, the House is expected to vote on government funding legislation. A vote on COVID relief will be scheduled after a deal is reached.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is scheduled to conclude its work for the year on Thursday, although that’s contingent on Congress passing government funding legislation and likely COVID relief as well.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/hearings?ID=DC444489-7775-4926-BADE-25FA0B04E127\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSyria policy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/hearings?ID=7EDFA2F2-363A-48B5-AA2A-000F8B59E73B\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003einternational human rights\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByEvent.aspx?EventID=111117\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003epresidential transitions\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. It’s unclear whether that will take the form of a short-term continuing resolution (CR) or a larger omnibus package that funds the government for the remainder of fiscal year 2021. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eMembers are also hoping to finalize a coronavirus (COVID-19) relief package before the lame duck session ends. Additionally, Congress is expected to approve the annual defense authorization bill this week.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAs of Sunday, lawmakers haven’t finalized the legislative text of legislation to fund the government or a COVID-19 deal, although negotiations on both fronts are expected to continue. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week Monday by considering the nomination of a federal claims court judge. Once it concludes consideration of that nomination on Tuesday, it will move on to the nomination of a member of the Federal Communications Commission.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe rest of the Senate’s agenda this week is yet to be announced, but the chamber is expected to consider government funding legislation and the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) before the end of the week. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is scheduled to be in session next week.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/early-outpatient-treatment-an-essential-part-of-a-covid-19-solution-part-ii\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eoutpatient treatment for COVID-19\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the future of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.sbc.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/hearings?ID=FC8E242C-B966-4C5A-AD3C-83E17DDE6704\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePaycheck Protection Program for small businesses\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/12/10/2020/executive-business-meeting\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ereforming liability protections for social media companies\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House begins its week with Monday votes on a series of bipartisan bills related to foreign policy and preventing student loan scams. Tuesday will feature a vote on the NDAA and more relatively bipartisan bills.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eOn Wednesday or Thursday, the House is expected to vote on government funding legislation. A vote on COVID relief will be scheduled after a deal is reached.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House is scheduled to conclude its work for the year on Thursday, although that’s contingent on Congress passing government funding legislation and likely COVID relief as well.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/hearings?ID=DC444489-7775-4926-BADE-25FA0B04E127\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSyria policy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/hearings?ID=7EDFA2F2-363A-48B5-AA2A-000F8B59E73B\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003einternational human rights\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByEvent.aspx?EventID=111117\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003epresidential transitions\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eCongress returns this week from Thanksgiving recess facing a December 11th deadline to pass legislation to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46545-avoiding-partial-gov-t-shutdown-passing-covid-19-relief-loom-large-lame-duck-session\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003efund the government and avoid a partial government shutdown\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. Lawmakers \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46575-bipartisan-bicameral-deal-spending-levels-reached-lawmakers-work-approve-omnibus-december-11th-deadline\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ereached a bipartisan deal on topline spending levels\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e last week, and may bring a funding bill to the floor before the end of this week.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eLeaders in both parties have expressed a desire to pass coronavirus relief legislation before the end of the year, but there has been \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/45588-what-is-status-phase-4-coronavirus-relief-bill\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003elittle progress to date in reaching a compromise\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e and it is unclear whether any progress will be made this week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eTime is dwindling for Congress to process bills to fund the government and provide coronavirus relief given that the House’s final scheduled day in session is December 10th and the Senate only has one work week on the calendar after that date.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate convenes Monday for a procedural vote on the nomination of Taylor McNeel to be a U.S. district judge for the Southern District of Mississippi. A confirmation vote will likely occur Tuesday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eFollowing the McNeel nomination, the Senate is expected to consider another district court nomination, in addition nominees to the federal claims court and the National Credit Union Administration Board.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate may also reconsider the nomination of Judy Shelton to serve on the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, which failed a procedural motion by one vote while Sen. Chuck Grassley (R-IA) was quarantined for COVID-19.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on legislation to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/11/26/2020/executive-business-meeting\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ereform immunities for social media platforms\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.foreign.senate.gov/hearings/uae-arms-sales-1130201\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eU.S. arms sales to the United Arab Emirates\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.banking.senate.gov/hearings/11/20/2020/the-quarterly-cares-act-report-to-congress\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003equarterly report\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e about the implementation of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/bills/hr748-116\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCARES Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House starts its week on Wednesday with votes on five bills under the fast-track suspension of the rules process, including legislation to require foreign companies to certify that they aren’t owned or controlled by a foreign government to issue securities.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe rest of the week is expected to be headlined by a vote on the MORE Act, which would decriminalize marijuana at the federal level and expunge related criminal convictions. It will also feature bills to expand the use of bounties in the pursuit of suspected war criminals, and ban the breeding and private possession of “big cats” (such as lions and tigers). Additional bills may be added to the schedule.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://veterans.house.gov/events/hearings/a-time-for-change-assessing-the-need-to-modernize-veteran-eligibility-for-care\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003emodernizing veteran eligibility for VA care\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e,\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\\\"https://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByEvent.aspx?EventID=111102\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eoversight of the COVID-19 response by the Treasury Dept. and Federal Reserve\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByEvent.aspx?EventID=111105\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eensuring the 2020 Census count is complete and accurate\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eCongress returns this week from Thanksgiving recess facing a December 11th deadline to pass legislation to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46545-avoiding-partial-gov-t-shutdown-passing-covid-19-relief-loom-large-lame-duck-session\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003efund the government and avoid a partial government shutdown\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. Lawmakers \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46575-bipartisan-bicameral-deal-spending-levels-reached-lawmakers-work-approve-omnibus-december-11th-deadline\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ereached a bipartisan deal on topline spending levels\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e last week, and may bring a funding bill to the floor before the end of this week. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eLeaders in both parties have expressed a desire to pass coronavirus relief legislation before the end of the year, but there has been \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/45588-what-is-status-phase-4-coronavirus-relief-bill\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003elittle progress to date in reaching a compromise\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e and it is unclear whether any progress will be made this week.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eTime is dwindling for Congress to process bills to fund the government and provide coronavirus relief given that the House’s final scheduled day in session is December 10th and the Senate only has one work week on the calendar after that date.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate convenes Monday for a procedural vote on the nomination of Taylor McNeel to be a U.S. district judge for the Southern District of Mississippi. A confirmation vote will likely occur Tuesday.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eFollowing the McNeel nomination, the Senate is expected to consider another district court nomination, in addition nominees to the federal claims court and the National Credit Union Administration Board.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate may also reconsider the nomination of Judy Shelton to serve on the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, which failed a procedural motion by one vote while Sen. Chuck Grassley (R-IA) was quarantined for COVID-19.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on legislation to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/11/26/2020/executive-business-meeting\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ereform immunities for social media platforms\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.foreign.senate.gov/hearings/uae-arms-sales-1130201\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eU.S. arms sales to the United Arab Emirates\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.banking.senate.gov/hearings/11/20/2020/the-quarterly-cares-act-report-to-congress\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003equarterly report\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e about the implementation of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/bills/hr748-116\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCARES Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House starts its week on Wednesday with votes on five bills under the fast-track suspension of the rules process, including legislation to require foreign companies to certify that they aren’t owned or controlled by a foreign government to issue securities.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe rest of the week is expected to be headlined by a vote on the MORE Act, which would decriminalize marijuana at the federal level and expunge related criminal convictions. It will also feature bills to expand the use of bounties in the pursuit of suspected war criminals, and ban the breeding and private possession of “big cats” (such as lions and tigers). Additional bills may be added to the schedule.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://veterans.house.gov/events/hearings/a-time-for-change-assessing-the-need-to-modernize-veteran-eligibility-for-care\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003emodernizing veteran eligibility for VA care\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByEvent.aspx?EventID=111102\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eoversight of the COVID-19 response by the Treasury Dept. and Federal Reserve\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByEvent.aspx?EventID=111105\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eensuring the 2020 Census count is complete and accurate\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. 12.4.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":12,\"reaction_config\":[{\"icon\":\"excited\",\"color\":\"#EE4950\",\"stance\":\"excited\"},{\"icon\":\"happy\",\"color\":\"#EDB723\",\"stance\":\"happy\"},{\"icon\":\"apathetic\",\"color\":\"#3AB093\",\"stance\":\"apathetic\"},{\"icon\":\"sad\",\"color\":\"#5ACDED\",\"stance\":\"sad\"},{\"icon\":\"angry\",\"color\":\"#624960\",\"stance\":\"angry\"}],\"reaction_config_id\":1,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-12-04T18:26:24.572Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"12.4.20\",\"issue_ids\":[\"congress-shenanigans\",\"upcoming-bills\"]},{\"title\":\"House Returns From Recess, Senate Considers Nominations to District Courts and the Fed\",\"id\":46524,\"slug\":\"46524-house-returns-recess-senate-considers-nominations-district-courts-fed\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46524-house-returns-recess-senate-considers-nominations-district-courts-fed\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46524-house-returns-recess-senate-considers-nominations-district-courts-fed/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46524/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House returns from its pre- and post-election recess this week for a five day work week, while the Senate is set to consider more judicial nominations and potentially fill a vacancy on the Federal Reserve Board of Governors.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eCongressional leaders in both parties have expressed a desire to pass coronavirus relief legislation before the end of the year, but there has been \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/45588-what-is-status-phase-4-coronavirus-relief-bill\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003elittle progress to date in reaching a compromise\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e and it appears unlikely that a bipartisan package will get a vote this week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAt the end of the week, both chambers will adjourn for their Thanksgiving district work period, and both are expected to return on Monday, November 30th. The federal government is currently funded through December 11th, so lawmakers will need to approve a spending package before then to avert a partial government shutdown.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House convenes Monday for its first day of floor votes since October 2nd, when it will consider several bipartisan bills related to Native American tribes and veterans affairs. Monday’s bills, like most of those on the House’s agenda for Tuesday and Wednesday, will be considered under the fast-track “suspension of the rules” process, which allows for expedited debate and requires a three-fifths majority for passage.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eTuesday has 25 bills on the docket, including legislation to crack down on pandemic scams; provide resources for opioid addiction treatments; house the survivors of major disasters; and reform the aircraft certification system.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eWednesday has 21 bills on the docket, including legislation to condemn China for infringing on Hong Kong’s autonomy; emphasize the importance of U.S. alliances with Japan and South Korea; condemn the poisoning of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny; and support freedom and human rights in Eastern Europe.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is expected to consider a bill to reform apprenticeship programs on Thursday and/or Friday, although there may be additions to the schedule on those days.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on legislation related to \u003ca href=\\\"https://naturalresources.house.gov/hearings/ocean-climate-action-solutions-to-the-climate-crisis\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eocean-based climate solutions\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://oversight.house.gov/legislation/hearings/karshi-khanabad-honoring-the-heroes-of-camp-stronghold-freedom\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ehealth concerns of veterans and servicemembers who were deployed to Karshi-Khanabad (K2) Air Base in Uzbekistan\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e between 2001 and 2005, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://financialservices.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=406957\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003echallenges and solutions for policyholders and insurers during the pandemic\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate convenes Monday and will pick up where it left off last week as it considers a slate of nominations, starting with a procedural vote on the nomination of Mississippi Solicitor General Kristi Haskins Johnson to serve as a federal judge for the Southern District of Mississippi.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAfter a likely confirmation vote on Tuesday, the Senate may consider the nominations of four more district court judges and one international trade court judge. It may also take up the nomination of Judy Shelton to be a member of the Federal Reserve Board of Governors.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/hearings/early-at-home-treatment-an-essential-part-of-a-covid-19-solution\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eearly at home treatments for COVID-19\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/breaking-the-news-censorship-suppression-and-the-2020-election\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecensorship and suppression of news in the 2020 election by social media platforms\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and a bill to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/11/19/2020/executive-business-meeting\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003erevise Section 230 protections for online platforms\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"user_id\":795,\"cta_prompt\":\"How do you feel about this week’s congressional schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/c523b2/TWIC-6.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/c523b2/TWIC-6.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/c523b2/TWIC-6.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/c523b2/TWIC-6.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/c523b2/TWIC-6.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":646,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 11.20.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House returns from its pre- and post-election recess this week for a five day work week, while the Senate is set to consider more judicial nominations and potentially fill a vacancy on the Federal Reserve Board of Governors. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eCongressional leaders in both parties have expressed a desire to pass coronavirus relief legislation before the end of the year, but there has been \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/45588-what-is-status-phase-4-coronavirus-relief-bill\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003elittle progress to date in reaching a compromise\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e and it appears unlikely that a bipartisan package will get a vote this week.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAt the end of the week, both chambers will adjourn for their Thanksgiving district work period, and both are expected to return on Monday, November 30th. The federal government is currently funded through December 11th, so lawmakers will need to approve a spending package before then to avert a partial government shutdown.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House convenes Monday for its first day of floor votes since October 2nd, when it will consider several bipartisan bills related to Native American tribes and veterans affairs. Monday’s bills, like most of those on the House’s agenda for Tuesday and Wednesday, will be considered under the fast-track “suspension of the rules” process, which allows for expedited debate and requires a three-fifths majority for passage.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eTuesday has 25 bills on the docket, including legislation to crack down on pandemic scams; provide resources for opioid addiction treatments; house the survivors of major disasters; and reform the aircraft certification system.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eWednesday has 21 bills on the docket, including legislation to condemn China for infringing on Hong Kong’s autonomy; emphasize the importance of U.S. alliances with Japan and South Korea; condemn the poisoning of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny; and support freedom and human rights in Eastern Europe.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House is expected to consider a bill to reform apprenticeship programs on Thursday and/or Friday, although there may be additions to the schedule on those days.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on legislation related to \u003ca href=\\\"https://naturalresources.house.gov/hearings/ocean-climate-action-solutions-to-the-climate-crisis\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eocean-based climate solutions\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://oversight.house.gov/legislation/hearings/karshi-khanabad-honoring-the-heroes-of-camp-stronghold-freedom\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ehealth concerns of veterans and servicemembers who were deployed to Karshi-Khanabad (K2) Air Base in Uzbekistan\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e between 2001 and 2005, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://financialservices.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=406957\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003echallenges and solutions for policyholders and insurers during the pandemic\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate convenes Monday and will pick up where it left off last week as it considers a slate of nominations, starting with a procedural vote on the nomination of Mississippi Solicitor General Kristi Haskins Johnson to serve as a federal judge for the Southern District of Mississippi.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAfter a likely confirmation vote on Tuesday, the Senate may consider the nominations of four more district court judges and one international trade court judge. It may also take up the nomination of Judy Shelton to be a member of the Federal Reserve Board of Governors. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/hearings/early-at-home-treatment-an-essential-part-of-a-covid-19-solution\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eearly at home treatments for COVID-19\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/breaking-the-news-censorship-suppression-and-the-2020-election\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecensorship and suppression of news in the 2020 election by social media platforms\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and a bill to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/11/19/2020/executive-business-meeting\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003erevise Section 230 protections for online platforms\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate will return for its first work week after the election, while the House continues its fall recess for another week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week on Monday with a procedural vote on the nomination of James Ray Knepp II to be a U.S. District Judge for the Northern District of Ohio. If it succeeds, a confirmation vote would likely occur Tuesday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate hasn’t announced a schedule beyond the consideration of the Knepp nomination, but it may take up the nominations to several district court judgeships that had been teed up for consideration prior to the Senate shifting its focus to the confirmation of Justice Amy Coney Barrett.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on oversight of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/11/10/2020/oversight-of-the-crossfire-hurricane-investigation-day-4\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCrossfire Hurricane investigation with testimony from Andrew McCabe\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.banking.senate.gov/hearings/10/23/2020/oversight-of-financial-regulators\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eexamining financial regulators\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and several \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.commerce.senate.gov/2020/11/committee-announces-nominations-hearing\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eexecutive branch nominations\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is on recess and isn’t slated to return for votes until Monday, November 16th. Lawmakers may be recalled for votes with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://financialservices.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=406870\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eoversight of financial institutions and regulators\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e during the pandemic.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 5:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCloture motion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the nomination of James Ray Knepp II to be U.S. District Judge for the Northern District of Ohio \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eInvoked 62-23.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTuesday after 2:15pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eConfirmation of James Ray Knepp II to be U.S. District Judge for the Northern District of Ohio \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eConfirmed 64-24.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWednesday\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003ePre-cloture debate on Cannon nomination.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThursday after 12pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCloture motion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the nomination of Aileen Mercedes Cannon to be U.S. District Judge for the Southern District of Florida \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eInvoked 57-21.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eConfirmation of Aileen Mercedes Cannon to be U.S. District Judge for the Southern District of Florida \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eConfirmed 56-21.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNo votes are expected. Members could be recalled with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eTell your reps how to vote on this week's bills and share your thoughts below!\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e— Eric Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"user_id\":795,\"cta_prompt\":\"How do you feel about this week’s congressional schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/e1c0fc/TWIC-6.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/e1c0fc/TWIC-6.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/e1c0fc/TWIC-6.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/e1c0fc/TWIC-6.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/e1c0fc/TWIC-6.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":620,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 11.12.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate will return for its first work week after the election, while the House continues its fall recess for another week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week on Monday with a procedural vote on the nomination of James Ray Knepp II to be a U.S. District Judge for the Northern District of Ohio. If it succeeds, a confirmation vote would likely occur Tuesday.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate hasn’t announced a schedule beyond the consideration of the Knepp nomination, but it may take up the nominations to several district court judgeships that had been teed up for consideration prior to the Senate shifting its focus to the confirmation of Justice Amy Coney Barrett.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on oversight of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/11/10/2020/oversight-of-the-crossfire-hurricane-investigation-day-4\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCrossfire Hurricane investigation with testimony from Andrew McCabe\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.banking.senate.gov/hearings/10/23/2020/oversight-of-financial-regulators\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eexamining financial regulators\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and several \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.commerce.senate.gov/2020/11/committee-announces-nominations-hearing\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eexecutive branch nominations\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House is on recess and isn’t slated to return for votes until Monday, November 16th. Lawmakers may be recalled for votes with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://financialservices.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=406870\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eoversight of financial institutions and regulators\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e during the pandemic.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change.
