Sets Timeline for Confirming Judge Amy Coney Barrett to the Supreme Court\",\"id\":46344,\"slug\":\"46344-senate-sets-timeline-confirming-judge-amy-coney-barrett-supreme-court\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46344-senate-sets-timeline-confirming-judge-amy-coney-barrett-supreme-court\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46344-senate-sets-timeline-confirming-judge-amy-coney-barrett-supreme-court/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46344/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is debating \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46343-judge-amy-coney-barrett-confirmed-supreme-court\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJudge Amy Coney Barrett’s nomination to the Supreme Court\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e over the weekend and is expected to hold a confirmation vote as early as Monday night.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe confirmation vote on Barrett’s nomination will likely be the last congressional activity until after Election Day, as the House is continuing its pre-election recess.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate convened Saturday to continue debate on a procedural motion that was filed on Barrett’s nomination Friday. Known as the cloture motion, or the legislative filibuster, the motion must spend an intervening day “ripening,” so by filing the motion Friday, Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) set up a Sunday vote to invoke cloture and limit further debate to 30 hours.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eA simple majority is required for the motion to succeed, which would set up a confirmation vote Monday night.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eRepublicans hold a 53 seat majority in the Senate and have the votes to confirm Barrett because only two GOP senators have expressed concerns about the nomination, specifically its proximity to the election, and only one may vote against her confirmation.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eDemocrats are expected to force procedural votes on motions to delay consideration of the nomination and adjourn the Senate, as they did \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46293-senate-vote-500b-covid-19-relief-bill-extension-paycheck-protection-program-small-businesses\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003elast week\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, but Republicans are expected to continue to defeat those motions as they are made.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSenate Commerce Committee will hold a hearing\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on immunity under Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act and how it applies to big tech companies, featuring testimony from Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, and Google CEO Sundar Pichai.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is on recess and isn’t slated to return for votes until Monday, November 16th. Lawmakers may be recalled for votes with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSaturday\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNo votes were held.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSunday after 12pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCloture motion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the nomination of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46343-judge-amy-coney-barrett-confirmed-supreme-court\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJudge Amy Coney Barrett to be an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e \u003cem\u003eInvoked 51-48.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eMotion to table the Schumer motion to adjourn \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eAgreed to 53-43.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eConfirmation of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46343-judge-amy-coney-barrett-confirmed-supreme-court\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJudge Amy Coney Barrett to be an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e \u003cem\u003eConfirmed 52-48.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditional procedural votes are possible.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNo votes are expected. Members could be recalled with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eTell your reps how to vote on this week's bills and share your thoughts below!\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e— Eric Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"user_id\":795,\"cta_prompt\":\"How do you feel about this week’s congressional schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/55a3c9/TWIC-6.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/55a3c9/TWIC-6.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/55a3c9/TWIC-6.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/55a3c9/TWIC-6.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/55a3c9/TWIC-6.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":544,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 10.26.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is debating \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46343-judge-amy-coney-barrett-confirmed-supreme-court\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJudge Amy Coney Barrett’s nomination to the Supreme Court\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e over the weekend and is expected to hold a confirmation vote as early as Monday night.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe confirmation vote on Barrett’s nomination will likely be the last congressional activity until after Election Day, as the House is continuing its pre-election recess.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate convened Saturday to continue debate on a procedural motion that was filed on Barrett’s nomination Friday. Known as the cloture motion, or the legislative filibuster, the motion must spend an intervening day “ripening,” so by filing the motion Friday, Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) set up a Sunday vote to invoke cloture and limit further debate to 30 hours.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eA simple majority is required for the motion to succeed, which would set up a confirmation vote Monday night.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eRepublicans hold a 53 seat majority in the Senate and have the votes to confirm Barrett because only two GOP senators have expressed concerns about the nomination, specifically its proximity to the election, and only one may vote against her confirmation. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eDemocrats are expected to force procedural votes on motions to delay consideration of the nomination and adjourn the Senate, as they did \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46293-senate-vote-500b-covid-19-relief-bill-extension-paycheck-protection-program-small-businesses\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003elast week\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, but Republicans are expected to continue to defeat those motions as they are made.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSenate Commerce Committee will hold a hearing\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on immunity under Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act and how it applies to big tech companies, featuring testimony from Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, and Google CEO Sundar Pichai.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is on recess and isn’t slated to return for votes until Monday, November 16th. Lawmakers may be recalled for votes with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSaturday \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNo votes were held.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSunday after 12pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCloture motion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the nomination of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46343-judge-amy-coney-barrett-confirmed-supreme-court\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJudge Amy Coney Barrett to be an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e \u003cem\u003eInvoked 51-48.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eMotion to table the Schumer motion to adjourn \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eAgreed to 53-43.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eConfirmation of \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46343-judge-amy-coney-barrett-confirmed-supreme-court\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJudge Amy Coney Barrett to be an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e \u003cem\u003eConfirmed 52-48.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditional procedural votes are possible.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNo votes are expected. Members could be recalled with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eTell your reps how to vote on this week's bills and share your thoughts below!\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e— Eric Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"comment_count\":76,\"issue_slugs\":[\"congress-shenanigans\",\"upcoming-bills\",\"supreme-court\"],\"created_at\":\"2020-10-24T23:32:02.135Z\",\"status\":\"published\",\"snippet\":\"What’s happening in Congress?\\nThe Senate is debating Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s nomination to the Supreme Court over the weekend\",\"html_byline\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 10.26.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":11,\"reaction_config\":[{\"icon\":\"excited\",\"color\":\"#EE4950\",\"stance\":\"excited\"},{\"icon\":\"happy\",\"color\":\"#EDB723\",\"stance\":\"happy\"},{\"icon\":\"apathetic\",\"color\":\"#3AB093\",\"stance\":\"apathetic\"},{\"icon\":\"sad\",\"color\":\"#5ACDED\",\"stance\":\"sad\"},{\"icon\":\"angry\",\"color\":\"#624960\",\"stance\":\"angry\"}],\"reaction_config_id\":1,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-10-27T03:05:03.006Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"10.26.20\",\"issue_ids\":[\"congress-shenanigans\",\"upcoming-bills\",\"supreme-court\"]},{\"title\":\"Senate to Vote on $500B COVID-19 Relief Bill, Extension of Paycheck Protection Program for Small Businesses\",\"id\":46293,\"slug\":\"46293-senate-vote-500b-covid-19-relief-bill-extension-paycheck-protection-program-small-businesses\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46293-senate-vote-500b-covid-19-relief-bill-extension-paycheck-protection-program-small-businesses\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46293-senate-vote-500b-covid-19-relief-bill-extension-paycheck-protection-program-small-businesses/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46293/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate returns this week for votes on a standalone extension of the Paycheck Protection Program’s (PPP) forgivable small business loans, in addition to a $500 billion coronavirus (COVID-19) relief package.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, the Senate Judiciary Committee is expected to advance Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s Supreme Court nomination to the Senate floor, where initial debate over her confirmation could begin as early as this weekend or early next week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House isn’t expected to hold votes this week as lawmakers continue their pre-election recess, but the chamber could convene and vote with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eWhile the Senate’s voting for Monday is yet to be finalized, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) announced that the Senate will vote Tuesday on a standalone extension of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/45693-do-paycheck-protection-program-loans-help-small-businesses\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePaycheck Protection Program (PPP)\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, which provides forgivable loans to small businesses impacted by the pandemic to help cover payroll and other operating expenses. That will be followed by a vote Wednesday on a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46273-senate-republicans-vote-targeted-500b-covid-19-relief-bill-schools-healthcare-small-businesses-pelosi-mnuchin-talks-stall\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e$500 billion COVID-19 relief package\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIt’s unclear whether Democrats will allow either bill to advance, as each will require at least 60 votes for a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecloture motion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to succeed and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46098-senate-democrats-block-gop-s-targeted-coronavirus-relief-bill\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDemocrats blocked a $500 billion COVID-19 relief bill in September\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. Democrats have continued to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/45588-what-is-status-phase-4-coronavirus-relief-bill\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003einsist that any relief bill exceed $2.2 trillion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate Judiciary Committee will meet at 1pm ET on Thursday to vote on advancing Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s Supreme Court nomination to the Senate floor. McConnell is expected to then file \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecloture\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on her nomination Friday, which by rule would spend Saturday “ripening” before a vote could be held as early as Sunday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eFor nominations, invoking cloture only requires a simple majority, which Republicans say they have. Once the Senate votes to “invoke cloture” it limits debate on the nomination to an additional 30 hours. If the Senate votes on Sunday, Barrett’s confirmation vote could occur as early as Monday, October 26th, although it could occur in the middle or later parts of the week depending on the timing of the Senate’s cloture vote.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, the Veterans Affairs Committee will hold a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.veterans.senate.gov/hearings/va-mission-act-assessing\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ehearing\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the implementation of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/bills/s2372-115-john-s-mccain-iii-daniel-k-akaka-and-samuel-r-johnson-va-maintaining-internal-systems-and-strengthening-integrated-outside-networks-act-of-2018\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eVA MISSION Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, which made it easier for veterans to receive medical care at private healthcare providers in their communities.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House is continuing its pre-election recess and isn’t expected to return for votes until Monday, November 16th.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eLawmakers may be recalled for votes with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 5:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eMotion to proceed to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hjres90-116\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.J.Res. 90\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Community Reinvestment Act CRA \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eNot agreed to 43-48.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eDemocratic motion to adjourn until November 9th \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eTabled \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWednesday after 1pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCloture motion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eon \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eConfirmed 67-30.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eMotion to table the Schumer appeal of the chair's ruling that the Barrett nomination was Revell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\",\"user_id\":795,\"cta_prompt\":\"How do you feel about this week’s congressional schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/5140a7/TWIC-6.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/5140a7/TWIC-6.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/5140a7/TWIC-6.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/5140a7/TWIC-6.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/5140a7/TWIC-6.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":510,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 10.23.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate returns this week for votes on a standalone extension of the Paycheck Protection Program’s (PPP) forgivable small business loans, in addition to a $500 billion coronavirus (COVID-19) relief package.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, the Senate Judiciary Committee is expected to advance Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s Supreme Court nomination to the Senate floor, where initial debate over her confirmation could begin as early as this weekend or early next week.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House isn’t expected to hold votes this week as lawmakers continue their pre-election recess, but the chamber could convene and vote with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eWhile the Senate’s voting for Monday is yet to be finalized, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) announced that the Senate will vote Tuesday on a standalone extension of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/45693-do-paycheck-protection-program-loans-help-small-businesses\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePaycheck Protection Program (PPP)\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, which provides forgivable loans to small businesses impacted by the pandemic to help cover payroll and other operating expenses. That will be followed by a vote Wednesday on a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46273-senate-republicans-vote-targeted-500b-covid-19-relief-bill-schools-healthcare-small-businesses-pelosi-mnuchin-talks-stall\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e$500 billion COVID-19 relief package\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIt’s unclear whether Democrats will allow either bill to advance, as each will require at least 60 votes for a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecloture motion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to succeed and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46098-senate-democrats-block-gop-s-targeted-coronavirus-relief-bill\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDemocrats blocked a $500 billion COVID-19 relief bill in September\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. Democrats have continued to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/45588-what-is-status-phase-4-coronavirus-relief-bill\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003einsist that any relief bill exceed $2.2 trillion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate Judiciary Committee will meet at 1pm ET on Thursday to vote on advancing Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s Supreme Court nomination to the Senate floor. McConnell is expected to then file \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecloture\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on her nomination Friday, which by rule would spend Saturday “ripening” before a vote could be held as early as Sunday.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eFor nominations, invoking cloture only requires a simple majority, which Republicans say they have. Once the Senate votes to “invoke cloture” it limits debate on the nomination to an additional 30 hours. If the Senate votes on Sunday, Barrett’s confirmation vote could occur as early as Monday, October 26th, although it could occur in the middle or later parts of the week depending on the timing of the Senate’s cloture vote.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, the Veterans Affairs Committee will hold a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.veterans.senate.gov/hearings/va-mission-act-assessing\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ehearing\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on the implementation of the \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/bills/s2372-115-john-s-mccain-iii-daniel-k-akaka-and-samuel-r-johnson-va-maintaining-internal-systems-and-strengthening-integrated-outside-networks-act-of-2018\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eVA MISSION Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, which made it easier for veterans to receive medical care at private healthcare providers in their communities.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House is continuing its pre-election recess and isn’t expected to return for votes until Monday, November 16th.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eLawmakers may be recalled for votes with at least 24 hours of notice.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. All times Eastern.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eSENATE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMonday after 5:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eMotion to proceed to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/hjres90-116\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eH.J.Res. 90\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Community Reinvestment Act CRA \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eNot agreed to 43-48.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\\n\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eDemocratic motion to adjourn until November 9th \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eTabled 10.23.20\u003c/p\u003e\",\"share_count\":8,\"reaction_config\":[{\"icon\":\"excited\",\"color\":\"#EE4950\",\"stance\":\"excited\"},{\"icon\":\"happy\",\"color\":\"#EDB723\",\"stance\":\"happy\"},{\"icon\":\"apathetic\",\"color\":\"#3AB093\",\"stance\":\"apathetic\"},{\"icon\":\"sad\",\"color\":\"#5ACDED\",\"stance\":\"sad\"},{\"icon\":\"angry\",\"color\":\"#624960\",\"stance\":\"angry\"}],\"reaction_config_id\":1,\"is_countable_article\":false,\"published_at\":\"2020-10-23T22:10:41.313Z\",\"allow_advocacy\":true,\"signed\":false,\"signatures_count\":null,\"signatures_goal\":100,\"signable_progress\":0,\"video_url\":null,\"video_dimensions\":null,\"video_aspect_ratio\":null,\"formatted_publish_date\":\"10.23.20\",\"issue_ids\":[\"congress-shenanigans\",\"upcoming-bills\"]},{\"title\":\"Senate Takes Up Bill to Avoid Gov’t Shutdown, House Returns for Last Scheduled Work Week Before the Election\",\"id\":46192,\"slug\":\"46192-senate-takes-bill-avoid-gov-t-shutdown-house-returns-scheduled-work-week-election\",\"links\":{\"self\":\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46192-senate-takes-bill-avoid-gov-t-shutdown-house-returns-scheduled-work-week-election\",\"article_comments\":\"/api/articles/46192-senate-takes-bill-avoid-gov-t-shutdown-house-returns-scheduled-work-week-election/comments\",\"signatures\":\"/api/v3/articles/46192/signatures?include=user\"},\"content\":\"\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is set to take up a bill to fund the government through December 11th to avoid a partial government shutdown on Wednesday, while the House returns for its last scheduled pre-election work week.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eOff the floor, negotiators are continuing talks about another coronavirus relief package, although it’s unclear whether they’ll be able to break the impasse that has prevailed for months. Additionally, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46187-president-trump-nominates-judge-amy-coney-barrett-supreme-court\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJudge Amy Coney Barrett\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e will start one-on-one meetings with senators fresh off her nomination to the Supreme Court ahead of her \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46190-graham-announces-confirmation-hearings-supreme-court-nominee-judge-amy-coney-barrett\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003emid-October confirmation hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week on Tuesday with a procedural vote on a bill to fund the government through December 11th to avoid a partial government shutdown on Wednesday, September 30th.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe procedural vote is on a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecloture motion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to limit further debate to 30 hours and requires 60 votes to succeed, which it likely will given the Senate’s 93-2 vote in favor of a motion to proceed to considering the package last week. Assuming the cloture motion vote succeeds, a vote on final passage of the short-term funding package will occur Wednesday in advance of midnight deadline.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eIf a bipartisan deal is reached on coronavirus relief legislation, the Senate could quickly move to consider the bill before the end of the week if senators grant \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/38097-unanimous-consent-congress\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eunanimous consent\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to bring it to the floor without the usual procedural hurdles.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on oversight of the Crossfire Hurricane investigation with \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/oversight-of-the-crossfire-hurricane-investigation-day-3\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003etestimony from former FBI Director James Comey\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, an update about \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.commerce.senate.gov/2020/9/nasa-missions-and-programs-update-and-future-plans\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNASA missions and programs\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.commerce.senate.gov/2020/10/executive-session/8b42580f-8c46-4a3a-954c-a63775768528\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eauthorizing subpoenas for testimony\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eby Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, Google CEO Sundar Pichai, and Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe House’s week will begin on Tuesday with the consideration of 27 bills under the fast-track suspension of the rules process. Among the most notable is a resolution calling for the peaceful transfer of power following the presidential election.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe rest of the week will include consideration of an additional 23 suspension bills, plus a bill to prevent publicly-traded companies in the U.S. from using forced labor from Uyghur Muslims in Xinjiang, China, as part of their supply chains.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAdditional legislation, including a coronavirus relief package, could be added to this week’s schedule before the House’s planned departure on Friday.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://naturalresources.house.gov/environmental-justice\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eenvironmental justice\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, to receive \u003ca href=\\\"https://coronavirus.house.gov/subcommittee-activity/hearings/hybrid-hearing-secretary-health-and-human-services-alex-m-azar-ii\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003etestimony from HHS Secretary Alex Azar about COVID-19\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and the \u003ca href=\\\"https://smallbusiness.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=3436\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eimpact of COVID-19 on small businesses in the food system\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change. Thom Tillis (R-NC) Pre-Existing Conditions Protection Amendment to \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/bills/s178-116\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eS. 178\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e: Shell Bill for Compromise Coronavirus Relief Legislation \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eNot agreed to 47-47.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThursday\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eCloture motion on the motion to proceed to S. 4653: Prohibiting DOJ Efforts to Strike Down the Affordable Care Act \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eNot invoked 51-43.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003chr\u003e\u003ch3\u003eHOUSE\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTuesday after 6:30pm\u003c/strong\u003e schedule?\",\"cta_type\":\"reactions\",\"cta_text\":\"\",\"cta_url\":\"\",\"image_urls\":{\"large\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/49bff3/TWIC-6.png\",\"medium\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/49bff3/TWIC-6.png\",\"small\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/49bff3/TWIC-6.png\",\"thumb\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/49bff3/TWIC-6.png\",\"xsmall\":\"https://ul.causes.com/ul/q_auto/uploads/akW3yomg/49bff3/TWIC-6.png\"},\"profile_id\":1462,\"action_count\":295,\"html_content\":\"\u003cp class='article-byline'\u003eby \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/cause/this-week-in-congress\\\"\u003eThis Week in Congress\u003c/a\u003e | 10.2.20\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003eWhat’s happening in Congress?\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate is set to take up a bill to fund the government through December 11th to avoid a partial government shutdown on Wednesday, while the House returns for its last scheduled pre-election work week.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eOff the floor, negotiators are continuing talks about another coronavirus relief package, although it’s unclear whether they’ll be able to break the impasse that has prevailed for months. Additionally, \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46187-president-trump-nominates-judge-amy-coney-barrett-supreme-court\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJudge Amy Coney Barrett\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e will start one-on-one meetings with senators fresh off her nomination to the Supreme Court ahead of her \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.causes.com/articles/46190-graham-announces-confirmation-hearings-supreme-court-nominee-judge-amy-coney-barrett\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003emid-October confirmation hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSENATE SCHEDULE\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe Senate starts its week on Tuesday with a procedural vote on a bill to fund the government through December 11th to avoid a partial government shutdown on Wednesday, September 30th. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe procedural vote is on a \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/23700-cloture-senate\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ecloture motion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to limit further debate to 30 hours and requires 60 votes to succeed, which it likely will given the Senate’s 93-2 vote in favor of a motion to proceed to considering the package last week. Assuming the cloture motion vote succeeds, a vote on final passage of the short-term funding package will occur Wednesday in advance of midnight deadline. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eIf a bipartisan deal is reached on coronavirus relief legislation, the Senate could quickly move to consider the bill before the end of the week if senators grant \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.countable.us/articles/38097-unanimous-consent-congress\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eunanimous consent\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to bring it to the floor without the usual procedural hurdles. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"https://www.senate.gov/committees/hearings_meetings.htm\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on oversight of the Crossfire Hurricane investigation with \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.judiciary.senate.gov/meetings/oversight-of-the-crossfire-hurricane-investigation-day-3\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003etestimony from former FBI Director James Comey\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, an update about \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.commerce.senate.gov/2020/9/nasa-missions-and-programs-update-and-future-plans\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNASA missions and programs\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\\\"https://www.commerce.senate.gov/2020/10/executive-session/8b42580f-8c46-4a3a-954c-a63775768528\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eauthorizing subpoenas for testimony\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eby Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, Google CEO Sundar Pichai, and Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg. \u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHOUSE SCHEDULE \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe House’s week will begin on Tuesday with the consideration of 27 bills under the fast-track suspension of the rules process. Among the most notable is a resolution calling for the peaceful transfer of power following the presidential election.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eThe rest of the week will include consideration of an additional 23 suspension bills, plus a bill to prevent publicly-traded companies in the U.S. from using forced labor from Uyghur Muslims in Xinjiang, China, as part of their supply chains.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003eAdditional legislation, including a coronavirus relief package, could be added to this week’s schedule before the House’s planned departure on Friday.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003cli\u003e\\n\u003ca href=\\\"http://docs.house.gov/Committee/Calendar/ByWeek.aspx?\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommittees will hold hearings\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\\\"https://naturalresources.house.gov/environmental-justice\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eenvironmental justice\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, to receive \u003ca href=\\\"https://coronavirus.house.gov/subcommittee-activity/hearings/hybrid-hearing-secretary-health-and-human-services-alex-m-azar-ii\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003etestimony from HHS Secretary Alex Azar about COVID-19\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, and the \u003ca href=\\\"https://smallbusiness.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=3436\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow noopener\\\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eimpact of COVID-19 on small businesses in the food system\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eCheck below throughout the week to see the vote results and updates to the schedule.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSchedule subject to change.
